name: Old Sacramento Waterfront District
reviews: Fun place to see the old buildings. If you are there at Christmas time the light show is fun for the whole family. The underground tour is full of history. There are good places to eat lunch and lots of specialty shops. The train museum is really fun with old train cars and a old locomotive you can walk in. They also have train rides they are not lo g and the train moves slow but fun for kids. I would recommend this place during the day after dark more homeless people start coming around.

A great little slice of history there is lots to see and eat. The California railroad museum is awesome and very informative.there is a pedestrian walk through over to the mall we can grab lunch at Yard House or anything there. Yard House has a great happy hour starting at 3 weekdays and old Town is not very busy at that time. There are lots of options to parking weatherby meter or in garage or at the mall with validation. One of my favorite places to go in Sacramento. Did the underground to her it was pretty informative and really cool.

The train museum is really cool and gets five stars. There are few good restaurants but need more to do. Lots of empty shops and store front. Plenty of parking near museum. A few more homeless people laying around than you would like to see in a tourist area or anywhere really. Not San Francisco bad, but bad enough to mention. I hear lots of money going into the area but still has a ways to go. Fun during the day but pretty creepy at night. Streets lights aren't great and not many people, other than bums, when we were there.

Definitely one of my favorite places. From the train museum to the candy shop to all the places to explore and eat. There's something for everyone on a day trip. Parking is a little hard unless you park in the structure and other than front Street most of the area is under construction so there's less to do. But we enjoy the experience. it is a step back in time. We find something new each time we are here.

It's a fun place to visit if you haven't been there. I wouldn't plan on spending an entire day there, but there are some fun shops and nice restaurants.  The train museum near by is fun for kids. Old storefronts and boardwalks. Some grassy areas with picnic spots. You can walk down to the riverfront. You will have to pay to park here. Either meters on the street, or under the freeway.

name: California State Capitol Museum
address: 1315 10th St room b-27, Sacramento, CA 95814, USA
reviews: Beautiful building. Highly recommend the free tour which starts on the hour. I tried grabbing a self guided tour map and going at it alone while on a business trip but the tour guide gets you into places you wouldn't think you have access to as the general public. The tour guide was very knowledgeable. The tour drops you off at the governor's office by a hallway which houses displays from every California county. It's fun to try finding your county if you live in California. Overall I had a very good time here when I needed to pass some time. Good for kids learning about civics and adults who are interested.

If you've never been, I'd definitely recommend to go! I am a California native and have never had the opportunity to go visit. The location is beautiful and we'll kept. A lot of great facts to learn and perfect for a field trip.

I came here to kill some time but ended up really enjoying myself! It is free, the building is beautiful, and you're free to roam around and watch Assembly and Senate sessions. There was a wonderful volunteer stationed near the north security entrance who let me know that the Assembly would be issuing an apology for the Japanese internment camps while I was there. I am so glad she mentioned it and that I was able to watch.

It was SO fun to check out our Capitol. It's beautiful and has so much history. It was cool to see the different counties represented as well as one of the chambers. Also there's a nice garden area to walk around just outside the Capitol.

At the State Capitol, the past, present and future of California interact with equal force. The building serves as both a museum and the state’s working seat of government. Visitors to the Capitol can experience California’s rich history and witness the making of history through the modern lawmaking process.
Hours:
Weekdays 7:30 am - 6 pm
Weekends 9 am - 5 pm
Admission is free
Tours available hourly 9 am - 4 pm

name: California State Railroad Museum
reviews: I love this place! Total train nerd here and I always can find something to check out at the Museum! Make sure you have enough time when visiting because the exhibits are amazing. Also make sure to watch the movie in their theater that explains how the big four came to create train routes out west.

The best place to visit while in Sacramento. The staff and may I say volunteers are amazing! I don't remember the gentleman's name he's in his late 80s and he has been volunteering there I believe almost 32 years he was such a delight.

This is a clean and well-maintained exhibition. The staff is friendly and polite. They are knowledgeable and give you a good insight into the history of railroading in California. If you haven't been by all means go.

I visited this museum over 4 years ago and I have never forgotten it. I got the opportunity to go again and it's still as impressive as the first time I went. 
I love trains and this museum had really taken care of the trains they have. It's all set up in a very interesting way with a nice flow to it. 

The docents have so much information and definitely have a passion for trains & history. It you or anyone in your family likes trains or history - this place needs to be on your list.

The trains are well maintained compared to other train "museums" I've been to where they have become rusty. They also have lots of great artifacts.

It is really a neat experience for all ages and kind of a go-to place for us when we have visitors in town. In addition to a number of really interesting trains on permanent display, they also have a gallery that rotates frequently. It is a fun place to learn about railroad history. They have a nice model train display upstairs and a newly revamped kids' play area. After the visit, you can walk around old Sacramento.

name: Crocker Art Museum
reviews:
The staff are friendly and quite helpful! Each exhibit is well arranged. Check online or flyers for exhibit info. It is worth going!

I will warm you that the parking in some of the lots has a quirk: as of this writing, the meter in front of your parking space is NOT the one you pay and isn't always clearly marked.

A couple years ago I payed the meter and the $42 ticket.

My friend over here ordered berries n cream and it was the bomb dot com. And then I ordered a flower power which is a springtime drink and man mine tastes like really good cardamom. I think it's a nonprofit cafe too oh my gosh, thank you so much!

Any place you can learn is worth it. They were presenting American Indian art/history and it was an amazing learning experience about the past and present America that some may not know exist. Wish I lived in the area I would get a membership because they have an interesting calendar for 2020.

My favorite museum in Sacramento. I have visited dozens of times in my life and I fall in love every time. Shocking mix of an old Victorian mansion and a clean white state of the art modern annex. Chock full of a wide range of art styles, mediums and age.

Definitely Five Stars. Me and my family went together and it was absolutely wonderful. The atmosphere was great. I got so inspired while there. You also have free roam of pretty much everywhere in the building. The gift shop was also fantastic. The people working there and the entire museum were so nice. I am definitely going to go all the way back down to Sacramento so I can go there again.

name: Sacramento Zoo
address: 3930 W Land Park Dr, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA
reviews: Amazing place to bring your family. There's all kinds of animals here to learn about and watch. I had a good time here. You should definitely bring your own food and drinks. If you're visiting in the Summer, be sure to bring stuff to stay cool for everybody. Sun shades will be a must and sunscreen depending on the time of Summer you're visiting.

This place is great! My little ones had plenty to look at, and plenty to excite themselves with. We had an easy time locating all the exhibits. The staff is both friendly and knowledgeable about the zoo. We ate close by the zoo at a great restaurant. I love the location of this place because it's so conveniently located in the middle of everything you May need/want.All in all i would declare this to be a great family fun zone.

This little zoo is very well kept. We were fortunate that the animals were active and easily seen. My three grandchildren delighted in having such up close views of the animals. They also enjoyed feeding the giraffe. Activities such as this do have additional costs. This zoo is easy to navigate. You could spend an hour or all day    and learn something new about nature.  Animals in captivity are controversial. A zoo provides an opportunity for humans to experience animals. When a connection is made between humans and animals hopefully compassion is felt.

This is definitely an amazing place to visit if you’re ever nearby, especially with kids. The price isn’t too high, and all the animals are treated with so much love and care their behaviors indicate this. I’ve visited it several times and it never gets old, the gibbons have to be one of my favorite for their calls. I’ve noticed people complaining about the animals not being out, and please ignore these people. The animals not being forced outside is a good thing, it means they’re being treated with respect and care. And the volunteers and employees are so nice, respectful, and kind. Especially that one Grace, made the entire experience a lot better as her and her colleagues help educate the kids and they have fun with it too so they don’t even know they’re learning. The food too is actually really good, the stir fry was killer, and I’d seriously buy it if it was in a restaurant. A lot of zoos feed you slop, but not here. And one last comment, if you’re a kind soul please donate to this zoo, they care for the animals and they fundraise for animal preservation in the wild.

We have a membership to the zoo, and we do not even have kids. Nestled right near William Land Park in Sacramento, you are able to get up close and personal with giraffes, lions, gibbons, meerkats, and so much more! With over 500 animals, including exotic and endangered varieties, there is something for everyone. They host special events, have a Zoo Train, and the staff are very knowledgeable about their inhabitants. There may be no way that you would ever think that all of these animals could be right in your backyard, but guess again! Please do something for yourself, and put this affordable outing on your calendar today...you will not regret it. No doubt that your children or grandchildren will certainly enjoy seeing the animals, but then again, so will you!

name: Sutter's Fort State Historic Park
reviews: Really enjoyed the couple of docents who were there.  If you are planning a class trip be sure to get the guided tour or have a plan for students.  They no longer have paper scavenger hunts in the kiosk as the website says.  We had a hard time finding one online as well.  You may want to visit first and make one yourself.  But I believe guided tours are the way!

Neat historic site. Exhibits were great; just the right amount of information. They have actors dressed in period clothing. I typically don't like that sort of thing, but they were very knowledgeable and I enjoyed talking to them here.

Sacramento has a rich history. Not the most tantalizing or salacious, but interesting nonetheless. Sutter's Fort is one of those interesting places that makes Sacramento unique. It's always interesting exploring the little nooks and crannies within its walls and imagining what life was like a hundred and eighty years ago.

This is a fun random spot in the heart of Sacramento. It's interesting to hear the raw real stories of Sutter and early settlers. There was an elementary school class there when we were visiting. Apparently classes can visit, stay the night, dress in colonial clothes, and do fun old time activities. Definitely something to check out!

We had such a great day here.  So much history presented in an interesting way.  A real look into the past and what daily life looked like. Fun for adults and kids.  Dont forget to stop by the gift shop...they have so many fun souvenirs.

name: Tower Bridge
reviews: Just a beautiful bridge. I walk there every day. The homeless have started to move in, so there's places you can no longer walk to (the dock). I've watched the bridge go up and down (to let boats through) many times and it never gets old. At night the bridge is even more beautiful.

It's a good first attempt at an iconic regional bridge. Although it offers good views of the east bank with Old Sacramento and the goose poop walk with the ziggurat building on the west bank, it could be much more walkable. Installing bubble machines, giving tours of the control room, and a grilled cheese cart would be nice touches that could help earn another star.

The view at sunset is breathtaking with all the angles of the bridge and the glow of the sun reflecting off the gold.  You can also see the river and Old Sac from here.  

Also, have you seen the bridge when it's rising?  It's unlike any other bridge I've seen.

Sacramento has been my home for 16 years and I consider this iconic Sacramento. 

A photographer's favorite, be sure to stop by at golden hour sometime soon!
Beautiful piece of architecture. A highlight of Sacramento without a doubt. As a backdrop to Old Sacramento and the waterfront district it is a must see.

I go over the Tower Bridge Tuesdays and Thursdays in the morning between 4:30 and 5 in the morning it's beautiful whenever the lights are on and I can see the sun coming up have a wonderful and blessed day

name: William Land Regional Park
address: 3800 W Land Park Dr, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA
reviews: I really enjoyed it here, it's very peaceful and well kept. I really enjoyed the flower garden, and the park is huge with different sections, to explore. Like, the golf course and etc... But, there is one small problem, exiting out of the park, you have to navigate your way around the park to exit out...the no outlet sign has you guessing. Other than that: this park is lovely.

This park is very big! Has a lot to offer. It's right next to the Sacramento zoo, has a few ponds with ducks and nice flower garden. Great Local park. Definitely love the  Lotus flowers that come out in the pond every year, it's a sight to see.

Clean park. Good location. 
Nine swings, one of which there's a tire swing, four toddler swings, and four regular swings. Two play structures, one for older kids and one for toddlers. The ground is covered in bark and sand.
Clean restrooms.

I do enjoy going to the park and just breathe in the air right here. It is a nice park with big tall trees and cute ponds. Many families take their kids here on weekends and its so nice that I have seen people doing outdoor photo shoots. 
I can sit here for hours just watching people walking and the ducks swimming while enjoying my espresso. 
Sacramento can be crowded with so many different things. It is good to have a park like this.

I grew up close to the park and zoo and fairytale town. It's still the same. A beautiful park with many different areas. It includes a golf course, baseball field, picnic areas and to public stages. Plenty of ducks to feed and the Sacramento Zoo and Fairytale Town adjacent to the park make it a wonderful family attraction.

name: Fairytale Town
address: 3901 Land Park Dr, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA
reviews: Awesome place. Much better than the zoo for really little kids (under 4). Basically a huge park with fairy-take themed slides and play structures. As an adult, it’s just fun to walk around! The crooked mile is the most fun, but I recommend going when it’s not too busy.

Fairytale town and Sacramento Zoo are just across the street to each other. Fairytale was more fun for the kids. All the slides here are amazing and creative. Like you go inside a house and the climb stairs and boom you are ready to slide, crooked street walk was fun for both our toddler and my cousins 5 years old kid. There is a castle too. If there is no party going on you can go there too.

Amazingly wonderful, perfect for young kids! I love all the low tech interactive activities for young children. The fun slides, the amazing connections to familiar stories, the timeless wonder .. It's all so fun for everyone! The animals are a great bonus! My kids loved the teepees!!
Found this place on the way back from Tahoe. It's a nice stop for the kid. This is a fun&cute theme park with affordable price. Highly recommended.
Great. Especially for the little ones. And even much older folks too. It's been upgraded since I took my kids. Now I'm taking grandkids. Great day out.

name: McKinley Park
reviews:
Clean playground with lots for kids to do.  The play structure is massive with lots of different elements to keep kids entertained.  Only downside is that the play structure is so large and tall a parent cannot just sit in one place to monitor children and the fact that there are multiple access points to outside the playground I felt the need to constantly follow around for safety as there were several homeless/transients very close.  

Enjoyed the pond as well and children enjoyed watching the geese and ducks.

One of my favorite parks in Sacramento. Big enough to jog around (it's about 1 mile all the way around) with lots of tennis courts to hammer out your ground strokes. Space for gatherings large and small make McKinley Park a great weekend spot. The McKinley Rose Garden is also located here and one of Sacramento's many floral gems.

Looking forward to the completion of the water vault project so that McKinley Park can return to its full splendor!

Busy park with a huge playground for kids of all ages. My son loves this place! Also there's a nice pond and lots of walk paths for running or walking a dog. There is a beautiful rose garden on the other side of park as well. The playground is located right next to the library. A little tough to find parking sometimes since its downtown.
Clunie Library and Meeting Rooms very comfortable and clean. Attendant on duty for inquiries. Numerous activities did not interrupt one another. A Well Kept Secret for Events and Meetings.

Beautiful park, but half of it is being ruined by the sewage tanks they are putting in. It was so much better 3 years ago, but it's still a fantastic park. They have a pond, a huge wooden jungle gym for the kids, tennis courts, a basketball court, a rose garden, and ample outdoor space. It's a really big park that you should definitely check out.

name: Cathedral of the Blessed Sacrament
reviews: I've been a long time visitor to the Cathedral of The Blessed Sacrament. The building is very nice and the people are very welcoming and helpful to anyone. Parking near the church is quite expensive, normally $10-$15, so I would suggest for you to park a little further so you don't have to pay the fee. The masses teach me a lot about different things that I could use in my life myself. The architecture looks really nice and you could learn a lot about how buildings were built in the 1880s, the Renaissance Revival times. I like a lot of Cathedral that I can't tell you right now, but I just love it overall.
Visited this beautiful sanctuary for a community worship gathering! Absolutely stunning. Parking can be difficult. I highly recommend going to hear the pipe organ!
Beautiful church. At the right of election I got to meet the bishop we had a very blessed day here. 🙌🙏

I'm the owner of Over The Top Events Parties, and two weeks ago my bride wed here. This cathedral is beautiful, dramatic backdrop for your wedding. I look forward to planning more event's.  Titi is their coordinator for cathedral and her team was great.

If you ever want to escape the crowds of Sacramento and want to have some peace and quite then there is no better place. The wonderful architecture will keep you in awe and the prayers that are always going on inside will keep you grounded in reality.

name: California State Capitol Park
reviews:
A beautiful and fun park, surrounded by stately architecture, filled with many playful squirrels and only a few well behaved transients. Walked around for a couple of hours enjoying the memorials, the horticulture, and the very entertaining squirrels.

Plenty of clean benches spread throughout, very safe (many joggers, police patrolling every so often, quite visible). Could use some more wayfinding aides, especially nearby & notable experiences/institutions.

This beautiful park is filled with just about every kind of tree that is native to California. There are paths winding throughout and more squirrels than you can count. The park is kept very clean and there is plenty of places to sit, or picnic, or run. The sidewalk surrounding this park is exactly one mile around so you can monitor your distance.

I always come here because I run the California International Marathon.  It's a beautiful place for having the finish line. The park is nice and big and very well maintained. Kids love to play and hangout here.
Nice place, very nice and family friendly park. We love visiting it to enjoy blooming magnolias and roses. Love it!
Huge park,  they keep the homeless out and it's well maintained.  6 place for a walk, run, picnic, or a game of catch.  Just needs more parking.

name: Sacramento History Museum
reviews: Do the underground tour, I like this museum you will be able to take some fantastic pictures and get a lot of historical information. Be aware it’s not a large museum but plan like 1 -2 hours and you will have a great time.
This was a great your. Sap was our guide and he was great. Very interesting to look at and listen.

Only had a brief time to explore but some cool agricultural and historical info. A small section of old Sac Bee printing equipment and lots of nice displays of local artifacts. It's a great to shop around in Old Town and see the museum as well. Took the Sacramento Underground tour, which is good to do at least once if the history interests you.
Great place to see what Sacramento was built on literally and figuratively! Beautiful tour
Great museum! Excellent displays and info, self guided, no time limits to view!!

name: Leland Stanford Mansion State Historic Park
reviews: Love history beautiful home just didn't have time to take the tour. Every hour the top of the hour. Admired the structure around the mansion though.

Amazing place of history. They only allow you to take photos outside. Inside photography are not allowed. I don't know why. It doesn't matter. The tour was short, but excellent. Amazing structure. Definitely will visit again for a full tour. I'll post more photos later.

Beautiful mansion that was the office of the Governor during the Civil War.  More recently it was the second office of Schwarzenegger.  The grounds are kept vintage Victorian.  The entire mansion and grounds are operated by California State Parks. Walk up Tours available...check the State Parks website for hours.
I took these photos in the early morning.  The juxtaposed image of Victorian Sacramento against a 1960s high rise is beautiful.

The mansion offers excellent free tours of the house. 
- You'll get to see what the house looked like over the years. The house and most of the levels showcases beautifully well preserved architecture and furnishings. Other levels show off what the house looked like when it was remodeled to become an orphanage. 
-The tour guides are friendly, interesting, and can answer pretty much any questions you can think of. Definitely pay this land mark a visit!
A great historical place to visit! Can't beat the price! It's free! Guides in every room to give you some historical background. We will be back!

name: California Museum
reviews: This place has wonderful hands on displays  for  children and young people. People of all ages will be educated and impressed with the exhibits.  The information is presented very well.

Great museum with so much California history. Their new Gold Mountain exhibit on Chinese contributions to California is excellent! Take the time to push buttons and watch the videos on individuals who helped make California what it is today!
Great displays and a good place to take the family. Lots of great exhibits. Gift shop has a variety of souvenirs to choose from. Staff was also very friendly.
Went here for the opening of the Chinese-American exhibit with my family.  It was great!  From the native American area to the healthy eating area - great education for kids.
My Neighbor and I spent about 2 hours here; although I think we really needed more time! The museum needs a map  because you can easily get lost in the place!! We loved the gift shop!

name: State Indian Museum
reviews: If you're like me and grew up in California than the last time you probably gave the native Americans any more than a few seconds of thought was back in the fourth grade. Growing older I realize the importance of recognizing the history of the land that is underneath your feet-- especially where you call home. If you call Sacramento your home I implore you to visit museums such as these and do a little "time travel" within a few thousand square feet.

This is an interesting museum that provides insights to local Indian history. For those who are unfamiliar with Indian culture and visit from other International First Nations Peoples it would be advantageous to be able to take photos. Further displays have better lighting to easily read the displays.

Informative and very well taken care of! 
Nice experience!
I have not made it to the State Indian Museum as of yet. But I'm definitely looking forward to getting there sometime.
This is a wonderful museum that highlights California Native Americans.

name: Discovery Park
reviews: Beautiful park! Lots of parking and great views of Downtown Sacramento. It’s very peaceful and nice here. Great spot for a picnic or just time outdoors.
It's a very large park, but not much to do here. It has parking, bike paths and restrooms. Buy it looks like it used to be nicer.

Great place for a concert but the crowd was TERRIBLE. ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. And nothing was done to keep people from being straight up TRASH in every way. Will never attend an Aftershock ever again, the only thing that made it worthwhile was my favorite band System of a Down, who put on an incredible proformance

Aftershock festival 2019 was amazing. Discovery Park is a great setting and venue for event like this. We had such a fun time, being in the park was beautiful. The shade was a life saver mid day.
I'm sure this park is great at being a park too. This weekend the music took over and did the park killed it.

My wife and i went to have a picnic and enjoy the view of the river. It was quiet, peaceful, and a bit romantic, just as perfect a day as i had hoped for. There's picnic benches and plenty of parking. There's bike trails and a boat launch, and plenty of trees with the leaves begining to turn all those incredible colors that they do. It's a great time to go there.....

name: Old Sacramento Schoolhouse Museum
reviews: Good place to learn about the history of school house.
Cute. Quaint. Worth a look, but don't expect to spend much time there

This cute museum is run by friendly voulenteers with a passion for history. If you happen to catch it while it's open, (weekday mornings/early afternoons are your best bet) come on inside, look around, and say hello! You can write on the slates on the desks, flip through the old textbooks, and maybe take something home from the small gift shop. All in all, a great place to stop by if you're in Old Sacramento.
Jo Ann is a truly an amazing woman with so much history and knowledge. Thank you for the beautiful experience.
Definitely take your children here! So cute! Make sure to read the picturea. It ia very interesting.

name: Powerhouse Science Center
reviews: I participated in a 1st grade field trip to the planetarium. The show was fun and informative; the kids enjoyed the experience. However, the Q&A portion of the event made me aware the staff is either uninformed on the basics of science or cannot answer the simplest of questions on the spot. If it wasn't for the fact the audience was a class of 1st graders, I'm sure someone would have challenged quite a few of the answers given.

A fun little interactive museum. Great for kids or kids at ❤️. I had fun exploring the exhibits and played as much as any kid there. Definitely worth a visit and I can't wait to see what they do with their new location next year.
Think of it as a condensed version of a normal science museum, appropriate for 4-8 yr olds. My daughter enjoyed the time there. Many sections are closed off for groups, which I feel is a bummer.
The science museum was lots of fun and interactive learning. The planetarium was amazing!!! The gentleman, David, really knew his stuff and I learned so much. It was fantastic.
Great, fun and fascinating place to take children. Lots of hands on activities. Fun and education all bundled in one.

name: River Walk Park
reviews: Nice little picnic place. Very little free parking so will most likely have to park in garage. Great little walk to the Tower Bridge and into Old Sac. My small kiddos always enjoy it. Only downside is the trash cans are always overflowing.
Had a nice time on the river Walk Park with my friend very beautiful outside and a nice scenery thanks Brit for getting me out of the house I needed that
It's great every sunday I go walking with my boyfriend out there

Looks like a nice place during the day. However, being downtown, in the evening and weekends when the business are closed homeless people move in around the benches and under the bridge.  The grassy park area and walking path are still nice and the area was clean.
Very beautiful vantage to view downtown Sacramento. It's funny though. Everyone is busy staring at their phones. Beauty all around and they can't stay off Facebook.

name: Fredrick N. Evans Rose Garden | McKinley Park
reviews: Had a good time in the beautiful scenery rose garden. A great time to shoot here is at sunset. The park was pretty empty when we got there. The park has so many different scenes you can choose from. Overall it’s a great place to spend time with your family
Beautiful and extensive rose garden in McKinley Park. We visited out of season but it was still worth the visit. Can't wait to visit in the spring when  all the buds pop!

A very beautiful, must-see park of Sacramento. People young and old will enjoy coming here ( a little ways down they have a great playground & tons of shade thanks to the huge trees. There is also a really cute 'fairy door' at one of them). Plenty of parking & people are friendly; the only downside was some littering but that is at the fault of the visitors not the park itself.

Beautiful park for a walk with the family any time during the day. Lots of flowers that makes beautiful backgrounds for memories and photography. 

Come here to explore for at least an hour and bring your loved ones for great colorful pictures!

Lovely place for taking photos in the Rose garden or taking a casual stroll around the park. Garden is on the same grounds as the Playground which has a dedicated section for toddlers and youth. Sadly I don't know what the outcome will be but,there is also a sewer/overflow plant being built in the same compound of the park. Residents I've spoken to in the Victorian homes are not happy. That is also why I gave a 4 out of 5 stars.

name: Old Sugar Mill
reviews: An old sugar mill that has been converted into a winery and picnic ground. It’s a little out of the way of everything else but I definitely recommend stopping by for at least a wine tasting if you’re in the Sacramento area. I’m pretty sure they host wedding and other events as well. Cheers 🍷
this place was a blast. Good wine, really nice to have a whole bunch of wineries offering tastings in one place. And dog friendly! Our pup loved our tasting  trip.
Incredible place, lots of options for drinks and food. Great grass area for picnics. Definitely a place to bring a significant other and the kids.

First time going to the Sugar Mill was amazing. We were not expecting such great wines and people.   The wineries are all pet friendly, giving our four legged friends much love.  We never had so much fun tasting wine as we did here.  It is a place you must visit
Really great place to go on a date. They had great wine and a nice picnic area to eat at on the grass

name: Sacramento RiverTrain
address: 400 N Harbor Blvd, West Sacramento, CA 95605, USA
reviews: Do visit when you are in Sacramento. You will experience beautiful natural beauty through your journey of 2hrs 30mins. I visited with my hubby during valentines so was just an icing on cake. You would love the variety of wine kept for tasting. Do visit and have fun.

Loved the train and the staff. The on board show was cute but it needed a little extra. Maybe some Christmas music in the background, livelier lights, a little more show, some displays?  For the price they charge per person, they can certainly afford it. I don't know their options as far as the train path but I wish it would've been longer or some nicer scenery.
An absolutely fabulous event to do for couples or a group of friends. Beautiful train ride with great views, tasty food and wonderful wines.

Fun train ride, especially if you like themed rides. This was the Great Train Robbery, complete with "money" that the bandit on board takes during the hold up. The stop for lunch was good, though hot out (is about summer here). BBQ served. If vegan or vegetarian, will need to find out if food for diet is available ahead of time. Relaxing, slower  (approx.10 mph) ride through farm land and river area.

We were celebrating a birthday on the Beer Train. There were three craft brew tasting stations and a snack bar.  There was a live band and we were dancing. There is even a stop at a mock town for corn hole games and more dancing. The staff members were pleasant and helpful. I look forward to taking the Sacramento River Train again.

name: Scandia Fun Center
reviews: Fun center should be followed by only if you’re willing to pay top dollar for games made in 2003 and Also paying to win. There’s no specials here they just make it sound good and then tell you you have to “upgrade” to actually win. This place used to be awesome to go to and have fun with the family but now it’s just becoming an extortion scheme. Garbage food Way overpriced. Don’t waste your money just go to Chuck E. Cheese or Sunsplash instead

Great fun but a little run down. New fun card system sucks due to still not changing process for better so don’t understand why the new haste for the same results. But mini golfing is great, early special is amazing will go again before 12 to cash in on unlimited golf for $6+
Huge fan of the mini golf.  Went with kids and good family fun at very reasonable prices.  It is a bit aged but that's totally ok.  Staff were great too.

This a while
Back. Me and the kids always have fun here. Batting cages miniature golf, a few rides, a decent game room and I can't forget about the food I got decent food there. For the most part, when me and the kids did go we always went at the lucky time even though I don't remember what time that was but usually is nobody there so free rides for us. Just joking but the guys operating the rides were so bored after we ran out of tickets after a couple of hours they let us slide on a couple of rides just due to the fact there was nobody ther.

Scandia Fun Center is a good place to take the littles. It's free to reserve the party room for 1.5hrs  but you have to bring your own decorations and food....so we did. It worked out! Next time we have to come earlier to enjoy all the rides and activities.

name: Swanston Splash Park
reviews: The playground area is usually well kept with areas for younger and older kids to enjoy themselves. Theres a nice large field with beautiful trees providing plenty of shade. There's tennis courts, basketball hoops and a water splash park when its warmer.

There is a variety of spray ground features. The splash pad is usually packed in summer because there's a camp here. It has restrooms, baseball diamond, benches, shades, multiple sand pits, a play structure and a community center.

My kids had a blast! We will be returning. The splash pad was awesome. I even went through a few times to get wet and stay cool. There is also a playground the kids also enjoyed. There are a few shady spots but if you have a shade umbrella I recommend you bring it. This park also has a bathroom.

Nice clean park with lots of amenities! Water Play Area, Playground, Tennis & Basketball Courts, etc. As well as, plenty of parking! Great place to spend a sunny Sac Cali Day with family, friends & pets!
Great park, I live pretty close and love to hang out with friends around there. Definitely worth visiting.

name: K1 Speed - Indoor Go Karts, Corporate Event Venue, Team Building Activities
reviews:
The racing was fun (5 Stars)! But the young girl (Leigh) working the food part needs MORE training on dealing with the public!
 I can understand she was working on getting the race results done. But don't  ignore me standing there! How about saying I can take your order in two minutes. 
 It took over seven minutes to get a hot dog! Did not see her and went downstairs to get a refund when she pop up. If she can't do two jobs at the same time just do one!

This place was so much fun. The only thing I wish could be different is the time because it just goes by way too fast. A definite must check out on your own and see how much fun it really is. FYI  it is all at your own risk, so be smart have fun remember there are other people are racing with you accidents do happen so be wise, careful, and respect others on the track.

Hope was very helpful and fun to talk to! Everyone at K1 speed provides great customer service which is hard to find nowadays. Our work team bonding experience there was awesome and we all can't wait to go back! Thank you

We had a wonderful time. Online we paid a total of $50 for 6 rides for 2 people. We had a blast! Tbh the food court was super expensive & not very good. I only took video's & took a pic of the prices. I'm thinking of doing my son's 14th Birthday party there.

We love this place fun atmosphere but expensive for a family.  My only issue with it is how expensive it is and wish you got more time on track for the money you spend.  I hope that they will offer some family discounts in the future.

name: John C. Fremont Park
reviews:
Park in the middle of a bustling scene! Lots of restaurants, bars and coffee shops that are walking distance. They usually have events going on like Chalk It Up and other family friendly things to do. 
There is a great playground that's gated and has a stream of children for my child to play with. Restroom access is lacking so if want a clean place to go you may want to buy something at Karma or Starbucks to use their facilities.
Cool little pit stop area. Always interesting stuff going on especially on the weekends.
Late night/ early morning walks have been safe and without incident. I'm impressed with how clean the park is!

the sign says improvements by our tax dollars ,all i see is they took out the beatiful fountain the kids loved and replace it with an old statue from k st. and still no rest rooms like every other park in this town,perfectly good restroom locked up tight
A fairly nice place for the public to gather and enjoy the finer side of their city which of Sacramento.

name: Raging Waters Sacramento
reviews: Great for disabled, old people, kids 2-5. Has many rides/slides! Lazy river goes everywhere for people who get tired easy/can’t get around. Lots of lifeguards. Wave pools for baby’s!  Good food Carl’s 5$-10$. Pizza so so...The bad news prices right off the bat! Parking lot 10$. So go park  down street like 2 blocks! Locker 12$ so don’t bring stuff bring old stuff you don’t mind losing.  Don’t wear cotton(life guards will not let u ride stuff! No cotton! People say dirty water but it’s got lots of shade from trees. I don’t care about 🍁 in water.  But the owner could fork out for more signs no directions ❗️Not a place for someone who wants super scary rides.

Super pleased after our first trip! We bought season passes (which were super cheap) because it seemed to be the only military-friendly family park and the discount was unbeatable. 
Park was really fun. As a mom I was grateful to see so many lifeguards (actually working - I watched one quickly jump in after a little girl) who were attentive and professional. Security was on point. Parking was not far away at all either. My 7 year old loved the river and slides. Even my teens were happy. 
Food was a little pricey but it is a theme park so that’s to be expected. 
Will definitely be back! Highly recommend!

Slides were super fun and the park was really clean. I was surprised that the lines weren't ridiculous but, I should still have got to the park earlier. I wasn't able to make it to every ride before they closed but I didn't get there til 1pm

This place is super cool for little ones to teens and young adults or mom and dads for their kids. This isn't as great for us older adults who like the big rides!! Sun splash is better for the older kids and adults but raging waters is a cool spot and your first entry gets you a season pass! Can't go wrong there!

Average water park. Wave pool was pretty weak (4 inch waves --yawn--) No boogie boarding or rapids of any kind. A few decent water slides, nothing epic. The fair was pretty decent. Price was cheap for season pass combo fairgrounds / water park ($31). Food options were typical and normal fair prices (mostly high). Parking was good but a tad high ($15). Website and signs there show they open at 9am but it's actually 10am so we had to wait a bit. I'd give them 4 stars if they had any kind of rapids ride. The lazy river thing was meh. Seating was ample everywhere. Not too crowded even for a Sunday during the middle of fairgrounds season.

name: East Portal Park
reviews: This park has a playground that is enclosed which makes it nice for littles. There's also a bunch of toys and ride ons (trikes, cozy coupe, etc) that kids are able to play with. The main reason I decides to go to this park was to have the ability to take my kids to the bathroom however the bathrooms were locked on Sunday. I'm not sure if the bathrooms are open on the weekdays.
Loving the music shows the park and recreation put on for local residents of Sacramento and Placer County to enjoy great music with family and friends.
I took my brother-in-law to this park. It was well kept and they had lots of dogs running around. It was a nice park.
Great space. Clean park. It does get kind of dicey at night sometimes.
Beautiful mature trees, gated playground, excellent Bocce court, restrooms, clubhouse, open space.

name: Sutter's Landing Dog Park
reviews: This is a great fenced in and large dog park. There is separate areas for large dogs and small dogs. Seems like a great community spot with plenty of nice dogs. Also near some river walking trails and skate park. I rated 4 instead of 5 because I was worried the gravel would be hard on my dogs feet, grass would be better.
Its a great place to let your dog interact with other dogs of all breeds The river is just a stones throw away so you can  take your dog's for a swim to cool em off on hot summer days
This is one of Sacramento’s best kept secrets. It has some beach area along the river, a rope swing, and even some shade. What more can you ask for?! This is also perfect for trail running.

Nice dog park. There isn't too much shade so it can be uncomfortable in the heat, but there's a lot of open space to run around in. Mostly dirt, so it can get muddy if it's been raining recently. On the bright side, it's usually pretty clean.
Nice to walk; too many offleash dogs of the homeless

name: Southside Park
reviews: My kiddo and I have been coming here for years. 1st for the super fun kids playground. Spinning cups, good sized fort and a real merry go round (spins really fast). The duck pond is fun when the birds are around. There's plenty of open grass area. A little to uneven for soccer, but works great for letting my dog chase the RC car around. There are fun activities here all the time too. Last few times I've been the homeless WERE NOT A PROBLEM. Something you can't say for most of the other parks downtown. Great place for a family week day picnic.
Great park lovely attractions the kids had a blast. Easy to find and convenient parking.  Just use the bathroom before you go cause they need some work.
Very nice park! My kids love this playground. We never went to the swimming pool yet. We like going there on Sunday before or after going to the farmers market.

Great park for the kids and adults! Its spread out and there are many things to play on. Also the basketball courts have pick up games and there are tennis courts! On Sunday you can always find vendors near by selling delicious treats!
I go to many events here and always have fun. SacCirque park takeover is my favorite! All these circus people come out and are available to talk and teach at discretion. Great park.

name: Truitt Bark Park
reviews: Nice medium sized dog park with 2 different sections for small and big dogs. They have a water fountain for dogs and people, 3 benches with shade and balls for the dogs. Its always clean and the people are friendly. The only downside is that the parking is limited. I had to park 2 blocks away but didn't mind the nice stroll there. All in all its an A for me.
Everyone is so nice here. My dog has a blast coming here! :)

Small and large dog enclosures, sun/rain shades. The trees are still pretty young. Decomposed granite footing. Nice community of dog owners who use it. Might not be safe for women after dark due to homeless but fine during the days or if it's busy. Leak times probably around 6pm.
Great little dog park, lots of room to run. Big and small dog side, water, trees and benches for sitting. It's is a bit dusty though, but not too bad. Will definitely be back!

Great little park in the middle of midtown. There are usually a ton of people here, which is great for my one dog that thinks she's a human. For the other one, she has a great time running in big circles around the small dog park with her friends.

name: Museum of Medical History of the Sierra Sacramento Valley Medical Society
reviews: One of my favorite places so far. Very unique and educational. I'll be coming back soon. ^_^
Terrific, examples of medial equipment used by physicians in the past, examples of old elixirs sold to consumers,  pharmacies and stories of the pioneering physicians. Highly recommend!
Some real kool stuff. Learn and saw some awesome things that are great lessons on the history of medicine that have read about. Good for anyone that may love any history

Very cool! Went here for a nursing school field trip and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The curator is very friendly! All exhibits are well maintained. My favorite part was the heart valves and the iron lung. It’s not very big, but if you read every display you could spend a couple hours here.
Such a fantastic stop in Sacrameto. Curator is very helpful and friendly!

name: Cesar Chavez Plaza
reviews: I recently stayed at the Hotel across the street. Several times throughout the night, I was awakened by homeless people yelling and fighting in the park. The park looks like it could be a really nice downtown park if they did something to address the homeless issues.

Nice small park in the heart of downtown. City Hall and the Sacramento public library are both across the street. Sometimes you will find homeless in the area. Free concerts in the summer time. Also a farmers market during the summer.
Central place to bike through but definitely community space used by homeless, skateboarders, & people walking through on way to restaurant or somewhere else

Amazing park when they do concert in the park, or have a small outdoor event. Between those times (which is the vast majority), this place is filled with homeless and drug addicts. I wouodnt bring my kids there during the daytime, if there isnt a special event happening there. Its embarrassing and unfortunate.
Nice town center. Shopping places are kinda random but they have good stuff.

name: North Natomas Regional Park
reviews: Great place for walking, running or biking. Has new dog parks, covered space for farmers market but market is open only during summer months. New aquatic center going in which should make this a 5 star park. Park has a fishing lake but is not wheel chair accessable. Really nice baseball fields but no soccer fields.

Amazing pond great areas  but saw a fish left for dead on a stringer when I went fishing. If you go out to fish be respectful towards the fish, if you kill them then what will you fish? I understand catch and cook for large fish but when you just leave the fish to die  You are killing the future of this pond. Whoever is doing the poaching i will be looking for you! And ill find you!

Visually beautiful, peaceful quiet even with the sound of kids playing in background. Water fountains that shoot up from the ground great place to cool off in summer. I love to go here meditate and eat lunch a couple time week.
Peaceful, clean and safe.  Included pic of the moon, Venus and Jupiter (from left to right).  Happy Thanksgiving
My children play baseball and softball at this park and they love it. Its a great place to bring your children to play and have fun.

name: California State Archives
reviews: Sacramento Archives Crawl was amazingly interesting. History, history, history!
Impressive collection of records dating back to California's (as a state) inception. The archivists are super helpful and offer some great incite as to how and where to search.
Very impressive collection of the states historical records.
Very cool place to visit and learn about history and how its preserved.  Go learn a little bit about California's rich history.
Went for the yearly archives crawl. I will definitely be back to research.

name: Shasta Community Park
reviews: Very nice park. Amazing play structure. Very close to library. Clean except for the women’s bathroom. Been there twice and both times the bathroom was disgusting with overflowing toilet

Nice, medium-sized Park with a story book theme. It is located next to the public library. Well-maintained tennis court and basketball court. Two playgrounds with a nice covered picnic area in between. Also has a soccer field and a small outdoor Amphitheater.
Recently moved from the east coast & I always wanted to go. & It was everything I expected & more. They have some of the best burgers I've ever tasted 😋
Greatest jungle gym in the world. Best time when lights are on at night.

The facilities were very nice and well maintained. The play park was very enjoyable for our students(we visited for a field trip). You can reserve the pavilion for lunch for a fair price. My only complaint was that we encountered some rude homeless near the restrooms.

name: Garcia Bend Park
reviews: A beautiful spring day in the capital of California in one of the multitudes of parks is a pleasure you must bestow upon yourself.  Garcia Bend is one of them. Nestled in a nice upscale neighborhood along the banks of the Sacramento River it is a treat and a half. Quiet, serene. Amenities are path for jogging and biking, fishng, Boat launch. Tennis anyone? Or if you want to just  relax under the trees lying on the green grass.  I just moved from Texas and there is no sitting in the grass. Besides the various bugs, fire ants are not fun nor friendly. Just one can ruin your day if they bite you. This is my hometown and I'm glad to be back after living in Texas over 15 years.  You can't beat the weather here in a park like Garcia Bend.
Iused the boat launch.  Pretty uneventful.  I noticed the park was well maintained.  I saw a sign that said pay at a booth but never saw one.
Perfect park for family fun. Plenty of shade and seats for us hard working parents lol
Nice park. Very cool for family with  young kids and great for parties, exercising and enjoying nature
Super cute park , my 2 year old enjoyed being able to see the water while we were there aswell . Make sure to take off before the mosquitos arrive

name: Effie Yeaw Nature Center
address: 2850 San Lorenzo Way, Carmichael, CA 95608, USA
reviews: This is a very nice park/nature center. The nature center is quite small, but I personally enjoyed the park the most. They have wild deer, birds,turkeys and wildlife to see as you walk the trails. Great place to take a walk and enjoy nature and wildlife.

What a great place to get out with the family and see a bunch of wildlife right inside the city. Check the calendar for there free guided hikes, or show up early in the morning and take a walk quite hike. There are plenty of short trails that will take you all through out this one time walnut farm.

Loved this place. Got to see deer up close and there was such beautiful scenery. It was very peaceful and relaxing. Easy trails and no way you can get lost. There are also benches along the trails to rest if you get tired. You have to pay for parking but it's definitely worth visiting.

Is a great place to get kids in to nature. They have a couple of owls a hawk and snakes. Also a little museum and puzzles depicting wildlife and life of American Indians. Kids love it especially the younger set. Outside lots of short trails and American river.
Lovely trails through woodlands, meadows, and river, all in an easy walk.  The staff was very knowledgeable and passionate about the animals.  Good parking.

name: Sacramento Children's Museum
address: 2701 Prospect Park Dr, Rancho Cordova, CA 95670, USA
reviews: This is a great place to visit with toddlers and younger children. My granddaughter is 2-1/2 years old and she had a wonderful time, as did her 3 year old friend. It won't offer much of interest to older children, but that is not their goal. Highly recommended for the little ones and their parents and grandparents.

I went to this museum on free museum day and had a horrible experience. It was my first time coming there, and I wanted to give my 1 year old daughter a chance to enjoy learning and exploring. Right off the bat, I was told by a worker at the entrance that I would need to wait in the extremely long line that stretched along one side of the building and continued out along the side of the parking lot. She said this in a patronizing way, telling me that it was free museum day (as if I didn't already know!), and treating me with very little empathy or concern. After coming to terms with the situation, I stood in line for a while, enough to know that it wouldn't be ethical to have my daughter wait with me, seeing as the line only moved 2-3 feet every 5-10 minutes. She was already fussing and about to cry. I think it would've taken upwards of 2 hours before we reached the entrance, at which point we both would've had sunburns and tear stains on our faces. I quickly got out of the line. Then, in a final act of desperation, I asked one of the other workers at the entrance if there was any way that I could bypass the line because my daughter was having a hard time waiting. She said no, with zero compassion in her voice. Needless to say, I left! And I must admit I shed a few tears over just how bad of an experience that was. I don't know much about how good this museum is on a regular day, but now I know that the staff there can be very cold and insensitive.

Not as much of a museum as a play and create event. Lots for kids to do. Craft area, water area, dress up with stage, get and grocery store area. Kids love it... Just don't expect an actual museum. Staff is great and very attentive!

This place was wonderful. It was raining outside for most of our trip out to Sacramento, so this was a perfect spot for our almost 3 year old. She had fun with everything there. The staff were amazing and responsive as well. No doubt the next time we are in the area, we'll be back!

What a great place to take your children without a worries of them breaking something. The place is super child proof, staff is nice and caring. 

Spent 3 hours there also having fun watching my kids doing all sort of things, from driving a bus to entertainment in the water section.

I recommend it for an indoors afternoon activity or any day.

name: Crocker Museum Parking
reviews: The Crocker has always been my favorite museum in Sacramento I love the new additions that they've made in the past couple of years in the continuous strive to bring new Arts to Sacramento. I choose to take advantage of the first weekend of the month program that they have with Bank of America because admission is free and I usually find that time to see any new additions that they've brought to the museum and stop by to their Cafe and have lunch these are just some of the favorites from the last visit I had.
An Amazing collection of art practices; Each conveying one's unique grace for us all to witness.
One of the best parking Lots open for the best price $10 for 24 hours 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. $5 after 4 p.m. $5 on the weekends
Jazz Night. White Chairs.
Enjoyed this visit very much with my daughter.  The guide was exceptional.

name: Glenn Hall Park
reviews: Lot of bikes and unleashed dogs on trails. Scary at sunset while I am walking my dog on  leash and bikers (not allowed on dirt trails + w/unleashed dogs comes riding up on me from behind w/no notice. Pls bikers stay off trials where you are not allowed. And whenever you are out with your dog on AM River Parkway, pls keep dogs on leash. .It's safer for all + it's the law. .

Food truck mania was a hit! Faves were Rudy's Hideaway and Flavor Face. Water was $1 at the beer tent. Dogs and kids had a great time. Next time I'll bring a soccer ball and burn some beer calories off.
Great spot for a quick nature walk.
Beautiful multi-sport park
Nice baseball park area.  Good river trail access

name: McClatchy Park
reviews: 81 me and my grandkids had an awesome time at the park
It is a very fun skate park. Well maintained. Depending on the time of the day when you go there could be some weird characters hanging out there on the park.
This place is a treasure to the neighborhood. Great shade. Great walking path. There is a man who sells bean pies on the corner. They taste amazing.

I've always had a great time at the park when ever I've gone. The playground is very nice & my son's summer camp uses the pool facility to bring the children swimming. Today, my Church had our annual "Praise in the Park" event. I love when we come together with other churches & the Oak Park community to praise the Lord & just enjoy the day with family & friends. Gospel music, Sermons, Vendors, Food, Family, Friends & Fun...a GOOD TIME for ALL!! 😇🙏💪✊👊✌💞
Nice place for kids to play. I liked the creativity.

name: Exit Strategy Games
address: 9833 Kent St, Elk Grove, CA 95624, USA
reviews: My 12 year old wanted to do an escape room with her friends for her birthday, so we booked "Pet Snatched" for her and a few friends.  I didn't go into the room with them because that wouldn't be cool, but I did wait for them in the lounge area.  I could hear them laughing and talking excitedly during their time in the room.  They had so much fun, and I'm happy to report they escaped with almost 4 minutes to spare.  I would definitely book with them again, and I hope to get a chance to do one myself soon.

So. Much. Fun!  We had a group of 10 for some birthday fun and we chose "Conspiracy Theory".  We did our best of getting out of the escape room and used only 2 hints.  We were SO CLOSE!  It's an experience that is memorable and I highly recommend it.  Our host, Michael, was hilarious and SUPER nice and helpful.  Thank you, Exit Strategy!

We had a total blast at Exit Strategy Games! It was my second escape room experience. We booked Pet Snatched for four people, and it was just the right amount of challenging and has certainly made me excited to come back and try the other rooms. 

Our game master was Gigi, and we are officially her biggest fans. She joked around with us and made sure we were having fun and laughing throughout the whole game. I’m pretty sure she barked over the intercom at us at one point to simulate the snatched pets.

I definitely recommend the Pet Snatched room, especially for smaller groups! I’m looking forward to trying out the Spy vs. Spy room and the Wizarding School room. 

If you want to have a good time, go to Exit Strategy Games. And ask for Gigi!
Awesome room! Michael was a great game master and got all my references :)
This was a great escape room experience. The puzzles were challenging, but not too stressful for a casual experience. Our game master, Gigi, was fun, friendly, and helpful. I can't wait to go back!

name: Miller Regional Park
address: 2701 Marina View Dr, Sacramento, CA 95818, USA
reviews: Perfect place for events. The dead trees do appear a liability and it would be better for the city or property owners to clear them out the way. But other than that it's really a great big place to go run with the kiddos. Can't go wrong with that.
It's a beautiful park right on the river. Love the sunsets for I'm here.

Low key park, great for family events.  You're able to fish at this park so bring your license and gear.  There are a lot of shaded tables and a few grills.  There's men and women restroom, no doors, soap, or paper towel.  Lots of people biking, walking and some with dogs.

Nice little fishing spot. Boats where flying past here all the time. Didn't catch anything that day I was there. But that's how it goes, also you need to pay for parking. I forget how much it was. Not too bad tho. Not a LOT of trash but there was some. Overall, cool little spot. I will go there again sometime.
It's calming to just go sit by the water get your mind off things. See a horse every blue moon. Its a nice park.

name: South Natomas Community Park
reviews: This park does "Free" live concerts that all you do is being a friend or a group or just yourself and bring a chair to relax with a cold one from your ice chest or the vendors that are there to help you unwind. Worth going. Wish summer didn't have to end.
Best park in the area, lots of play variety available. Big open spaces for kites, soccer and baseball. Lots of cool surprises tucked away. It even keeps my 12 year old interested.

Very cute with a toddler section. However, there were a lot of older kids in that area. Still my nephew enjoyed it and I could easily navigate with him. Cool looking fort for kids to play around.

Please clean the areas though, there was a lot of litter in the toddler area and ice cream on the ground. I wish kids would respect the park better.
Perfect park for my kids and my family's kids
Safe but when there are many kids is not too safe

name: Granite Regional Park
reviews: It's a nice park with plenty of parking and bathrooms....It has soccer fields, skate park, and my favorite a pond to fish near benches and bbq pits....clean with the exception of some geese and/or duck droppings...I come here often and eventhough I haven't caught a fish I've sewn catfish pulled out of here ...they do stock the pond and you can find dates for Granite Regional Park and all other Sacramento locations to be stocked....
Peaceful but very small and limited parking that has a 3hour time limit. Not bad but not my park of choice for those reasons.
I had an awesome time I caught a 5 lb largemouth bass at about 4:30 in the afternoon on a red sparkly Gary Yamamoto rubber worm
Cool little local park. Pond has fish in it, but they're hard to catch!

Nice, it has about 3 soccer fields, lights, a scate park with a lot of obstacles, and it's very beautiful. It does have a homeless camp but they are kind of far away by the train tracks. They stay to themselves. It has a lot of parking and it's very beautiful.

name: Jacinto Creek Park
address: 8600 W Stockton Blvd, Elk Grove, CA 95758, USA
reviews: Very cool! Lots and lots of space, kiddie pools with hoses that work , water fountains for dog and people, lots of friendly faces. only thing I can think would make it better is baggies for the people, alot of the people parks around here keep stocked on bags so I figure if anywhere, they should have them at the dog park . That's all! (:
A well-maintained half basketball court, a modern playground, and covered picnic area, make this a good park for family outings.
My dog loved it. Plenty of room for dogs to run and play. She even made a friend. A cool mellow, playful dog named Bones.
Nice dog park. Very big. Friendly dog owners.
Nice and quiet in the morning. Playing ball with Gretchen.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt Park
reviews: Best place to ball in Downtown Sacramento with some actual competition and good sports. Love the trash talk and how many people come back every weekend. Love coming here with my friend
Got some new kinda workout contraption.  Looks pretty useful. Saw 4 people working on it . At noon some soccer goes on. And basketball afternoons.

The surrounding area is lovely and the workout center is great! I go there with a fitness and self defense group on Sunday mornings, and I love it! My one suggestion would be to add more amenities in the rest of the park.

I've been playing softball here for years. Field is well taken care of for a public park. Location means cops drive by all the time so it's safe. Great basketball courts (2) and a new public gym setup. No quality bathrooms.

I only go here for the annual beer n chili festival. Some years there are not enough trees for the amount of people to enjoy some shade. I do love that it is close to me and that it's got a fence around the perimeter so we can do beer tasting without being penned in

name: River Bend Park
address: 2300 Rod Beaudry Dr, Sacramento, CA 95827, USA
reviews: Great place to feel like you're getting away from the city. Lots of trails to get a little hike in. The wildlife is lovely.. Expect to see numerous species of birds including hawks, wild turkeys, valley quail and waterfowl. Blacktail deer and coyotes are around as well. Lots of mushrooms in the fall/winter and lovely flora in the spring. It's in the native range of the pipevine swallowtail, a gorgeous butterfly that you don't see in many places.

The scenery is pleasant. Good place to hang with Family for bar b ques, fishing, boating sports. Boat launch as well as vehicle and trailer hitch parking(parking pass required w/trailer).
Playground and recreational field. Bike trailer for walking, or biking.
Wonderful hiking and bike trail. Great places to be next to the river and see wildlife or go to the grassy area and have a picnic.
Nice park, and when you cross bridge there is another park just as nice.
Fabulous  to be walking  to tha river so much fun for the kids

name: Jensen Garden Park
address: 8520 Fair Oaks Blvd #2504, Carmichael, CA 95608, USA
reviews:
This Botanical Gardens park is Beautiful, It's always a wonderful place to stop & eat our lunch.. or if you're up to it, It features:
* paved walking paths,

* A Ton of Gorgeous Vibrant colored flowers of all sizes, shapes & breeds...

* It's Nesseled in this cute little knoll

* Perfect for Pictures, Groups, or Couples..

* Best time to go is Now - Oct

Enjoy !!!!
Such a lovely peaceful garden. I've wanted to come here for years. I was not disappointed. I'm looking forward to returning again.
Beautiful small garden! Loved the little walk! So many beautiful flowers!
beautiful park. great for pokemon
A safe place to relax. Admirable sequoia trees!

name: Bertha Henschel Park
reviews: Great little park tucked away in this residential area. Nice kiddie water feature and tons of jungle gum equipment.
Some bumps and holes in the grass on the field but a very nice play structure for kids and a refreshing water feature in the summer.

Nice park with playground and dog areas. Wish the fountain worked... it doesn't. Always plugged up and obviously not safe for human use. No dog fountain is a shame since so many folks bring dogs to the park.
Great place to bring your child(ren) to interact with other neighborhood kids. Lots of community toys to play with and at a great location!
Fun park with a tot splash pad in the summer. 4 basketball hoops and a large green area for other sports

name: North Natomas Community Park
address: 1839 N Bend Dr, Sacramento, CA 95835, USA
reviews: Very clean and nice park. The park is very interesting.  The place has ever green grass.  The view is very interesting.  Here the grass was well maintained and the grass is well watered. There are little tree in the area.  It is so spacious and attractive that it creates a special joy.  It is a great place for children to play and play as they do.  It is a place that creates a special feeling for adults as well.

Its a big park. If you don't give specific locations you could end up on the other side of the park. We use it to host a flag football league for kids on Saturdays. The league is call Refugees community service. Its a great environment for kids to play without worries of a negative surrounding.

Nice park for a walk or to kick around a soccer ball. Walkway connects park areas (tennis courts, volleyball nets, multiple play areas). Mature trees, playgound, benches, and pretty sculptures are highlights.
Great park and infrastructure for the whole family.  Large and easy parking, accessibility for wheelchair users, playground and water playground in good conditions.
Nice quiet park.

name: Sand Cove Park
reviews: Very nice spot. Great beach. You can fish. Pet friendly. Everyone that we met was very nice and all people just relaxing and enjoying the beach.

There is an automatic gate, that opens at sunrise and sunset. Prior reviews state the gate closes at 6 pm. I have heard the rates for admission have changed, so I won't post that info until I can confirm. It's a great beach and sometimes during the week, there are not many folks there

We always go this place beer can Beach it's great for kids nice Beach but last time I went and got a bladder infection pretty bad so adult probably should steer clear of the water... Idk.. but other than that nice when people no one bite the good place to just come and chill off Garden Highway. For cheap
Nice place to bring the kids and have a picnic. You do have to pay for parking
It was awesome. We celebrated my sister's birthday there. A lot of people were fishing and catching some good sized salmon.

name: Tanzanite Community Park
reviews:
Nice park this is ! They have a covered BBQ area, playground items for the kids, restrooms, a man made lake and a skatepark.

  The park appears to be well maintained for the most part and even though this park is next to the freeway it still feels fairly quiet in a nice place to go if you're looking to relax for a few. 

  I would advise that you be careful of walking and stepping in the " goose fecal matter ", which is just nature being nature.  I'm sure the park's maintenance for the city does the best they can but still be careful of stepping in it. Other than that a well rounded enjoyable park that I would recommend. Hope you have fun with your kids over there.

Great place to come bring the dog, have a picnic/BBQ, play frisbee, basketball, soccer but they have a skate park that's free as well as a lil fishing pond that has big mouth bass, bluegill, and a few other species of fish...there is a bathroom that's clean, it's well lite and easy to get to from the freeway and surface streets....its in a nice neighborhood that's well kept and looks to be very proud of their community...there's plenty of stuff for the lil ones as well...a big sandbox that has a modern jungle gym with slides and all the fun stuff needed to let them let you enjoy a minute ...
This park is a great park. We love it but the pond needs to be cleaned. More trash everyday. Clean up your mess people!
I went to the skatepark. I had a really good time and made some awesome friends. I busted hecka tricks too Gang gang
Nice to have ducks and dogs!!

name: Howe River Access
address: 7971 La Riviera Dr, Sacramento, CA 95826, USA
reviews: This access us behind Sac State University. You can park at the road or inside the  parking area. Good running and biking trail. Recharge myself every time when jog or bike on this trail.

Less clay, more sand on rivers edge. More "beach-like" than other parts of the American river. Beautiful bird's around. Numerous water fowl that are accustomed to a human presence so you may get to see em up close if you go here! We found a group of kids swimming and had lots of fun.
Been coming here since I was a kid. Now my kids get to enjoy it they love it
These "off-shoot parks within a park" are absolutely awesome and a great escape for some peace of mind along with quiet, cool, and serene surroundings.

It's free if you walk or bike in. I think it's $5-6 with a car. Probably more with a truck and a boat trailer.

In the winter, it's relatively quiet, a few cars and trucks in the lot. During the spring/summer the lot is pretty full.

name: Kokomo Park
reviews: It was a 5 star experience cause I was with the boys, but the park itself is somewhat small. It is perfect for one big party but not more than one. However, if you're here for some playground time and that's it, you won't need to fight for space.

This is a cute neighborhood park. There is a large field with soccer goals, basketball courts, 2 wonderful shaded playgrounds, and a BBQ area you can rent out for small family gatherings. The huge drawback is the lack of a restroom facility, as well as there is no fence along the boarders near the main road leading out of the small community. They do have 2 porta potties along the main road, which I think they should leave near the BBQ area for safety.
Not a bad park definitely a step up from the rest
Kokomo has playground equipment, a walking path, volleyball nets and soccer goals!
A bit smokey from the fires this morning. I love the open space

name: Oki Park
reviews: Nice, clean, quiet park. Splash pad is free, $2 to swim. Bbq pits and picnic tables available. Very reasonable price to reserve space for a picnic.
Great Place for Kids and Family to take rest and fun.
Quite a lovely place to lay down in the shade
We reserved the large area here for a bbq celebration. Signs are up that's great. Nice to be right by the pool and playground. But you couldn't take two seconds to get the trash off the table.
Nice gated play ground

name: Ancil Hoffman Park
reviews: It's an amazing getaway hidden in the middle of Sacramento proper. A golf course, driving range, a wonderful nature center and best of all nature trails.  The deer and wildlife are so sweet to see and enjoy in their natural habitat.  It's my favorite walk and run trails.  3.25 miles around.  The blackberries are a wonderful treat in the summer!

We love Main Event!  Great place to catch a game with a cold beer and fries (we love the sweet potato fries).  Service is great, you can sit on the patio and watch the first tee drives and swap golf stories with the locals.  Food prices are very reasonable, wish they offered a full breakfast though!  They also have a trivia night and live entertainment some weekends.

Beautiful park with wonderful wildlife and bird watching opportunities. There is a nice building with some special animals and interesting information about the local fauna as well as some gift shop items. It's very inexpensive for parking and worth a visit for anyone who enjoys nature. The trails are ideal for a walk and the river is nearby.
I've been bringing my family here for years.  It's a perfect family park with restrooms, nature trails, and access to the river. Good for catching frogs and playing with dogs.

Just wanted to share this information with everyone, since Ancil is a local gem, and I see some confusion in the comments below...You do have to pay for parking....unless you visit the golf course or the pro shop. All it takes to get in is to tell the ranger at the gate "pro shop", and you won't be bothered further. I wouldn't go park at Effie Yeaw, that makes it pretty clear you aren't hitting the links. Hope this keeps more money in your pocket and less in the states hands.

name: Firehouse
reviews: Their pasta melts in your mouth. The Risotto dish, was wonderful. All around the restaurant were happy faces. I enjoyed every bite! Will definitely come back to try the other entrees!
Just look and see.  Fantastic Happy hour eats and drink.  Tahoe Blue as their well for $6.00 during happy hour.  $10 appetizers.  Fabulous.

The day after Valentine's Day was my first time at the Firehouse. The decor and lighting were wonderful, with plenty of space between tables, adding to the intimacy it allows for conversation. The service was top notch, with continual water, and bread refills. Our waitress was amazing, and wonderful, making great suggestions, and checking on us regularly. The food price may seem a bit high, but every course was easily worth it's price. Perfect portions, and the food tasted impeccable. I will definitely be back.

I went there for a Best Friend's Wedding. It was quite the ambiance. Certainly demonstrated a measure of beauty and elegance that fit the wedding reception quite well. The staff was very friendly. The food was very tasty. The drinks were well-made that goes especially for the cocktails. If I live in California I would certainly have more events here and definitely eat there on a regular basis but alas I am from the East Coast. I look forward to going back there one day

This place had always been my favorite restaurant in town. Love the service her, it's always up to standard. I had my wedding her in January and staff was awesome, Randy was fantastic. Went above and beyond! This is a beautiful place to have your wedding if you haven't considered it. I would say this place is affordable once you add it up comparing to some places nearby. The Firehouse has a beautiful courtyard in the back and is lovely for an outdoor wedding.

Food was delicious! All of my guest couldn't stop raving about how great the food was. I got the Filet Mignon and Daily catch duet plate for my guest.
Firehouse had a wedding showcase once a year and I was able to bring my future mother in law to that prior to booking the Firehouse. She was able to sample the appetizers. From there, we narrowed down to what she liked, which made it easy to choose for my wedding menu.

All my vendors had a good experience setting up and did not have any problems on the day of (or at least no complaints). If you're thinking of having your wedding here and have outside vendors, don't worry about it, Randy will take care of it for you!

Anyways I don’t think my review does this place justice. Give Randy a call and he’ll make wedding magic happens.

Of course you can dine in and see if you like the food too!

name: Localis
