reviews: Amazing attention to detail. The food was outstanding. With each dish the chef would explain where his inspiration came from to create it, how it was constructed, and what was in it. Me and my wife felt like celebrities in their. Unfortunately I don't have any Michelin Stars to hand out, so I will only do what I can, which is write a review and tell all my friends and family to go experience this amazing restaurant. 🥰😍🤩🤗

All the food was fantastically prepared, well-balanced, and the flavors were spot-on, if a touch on the salty side (which I like, but beware of you don't; this is the only knock).  Two main complaints:  the glacial pace, and a few blocks away, I thought, "I could really go for some food."  The full plates vary widely in portion size/"fill-up" status, from what I could see, and not all are equal.  Mine had few, albeit tasty, bites.  They're apparently known for their tasting menu, so maybe give that a swing.

Inconspicuously located, Localis has an interesting and delicious experience to offer. The staff was all pleasant and knowledgeable about every step of the way. We ordered the fixed tasting menu as well as a small plate and a large plate. The scallop course was a wonderland of texture and the octopus was cooked excellently. Would definitely recommend.

I had the best 4course take-out tasting menu last week and wine pairing in little mason jars!! Delicious food & Amazing wine! Plus the fried chicken and dry Riesling wine pairing I picked up Monday was outstanding!!!!

Make a reservation and plan for a long and memorable dinner. We had a 7:15pm seating and ordered the 7 course tasting menu with wine pairing, we wrapped up dessert just after 10pm. There are no words to describe what an incredible experience the dinner was. By the time we got to dessert I forgot to snap a photo! This was our second time in and we will definitely be back any time we have something to celebrate.

name: Mulvaney's B&L
reviews: This restaurant has consistently been a fantastic place for great food and great atmosphere. We take out-of-town guests here. They have a family-style meal once a month that is SO much fun! That's an experience everyone should try. We have done it several times. Very reasonable price and terrific food and fun!
Extraordinary ambience and very amiable service. The meals were crisp and enchanting. Will surely recommend this restaurant to others. Reasonable rates and generous meals. Good job.

I love this restaurant! They offer high class dishes, their menu is nice, The cook in that place is a specialist, I like very much tasting all their food. The dishes are consistently of high class, the service towards the clients  is good. I visit often this place and I not even once was disappointed.  I highly recommend it.

Wonderful restaurant - the menu is true to farm-to-fork, with some very creative offerings. Well prepared and absolutely delicious. We started with the heirloom tomato salad which was large enough to share, and then had the pork tortellini’s and duck for the mains. Perfectly done. Great bar, excellent, friendly service. It is a bit on the noisy side when the place is full, but it quieted down after a few tables cleared. Reasonably priced for a high quality restaurant...our waitress was nice enough to waive the corkage fee. The wine list has a lot of local wineries, also nice. Our only small complaint was being seated at the kitchen counter when we had reserved a table, but the hostess moved us to a two-top when we commented on that. The counter (see photo) is supposed to be a great place to sit, since it opens on the kitchen and the staff let you sample other dishes. Maybe next time...and there will be one.

The ambiance is great! The smell of the food being prepared makes your mouth water in anticipation of the meal to come! There is a courtyard for small weddings or gatherings. Parking is hard to find due to the downtown location, but worth the walk if you end up a block away. I highly recommend this B&L!

name: The Kitchen Restaurant
reviews: Greeted by a smile from Chef T - warm & pleasant welcome to his customers! Our waitress was very attentive and sweet. This Elegant Modern Cuisine food was served with a beautiful presentation and awesome taste. Chef T prepared Salmon & Grits for me, the best grits you'll ever eat. Salmon was cooked to perfection! He specialized my moms Vegan Dish (Vegan Burger w/ Baby Green Salad). If you have a sweet tooth, order the peach cobbler for dessert. Make sure to stop by while your in Mercer Island!

This is the food experience you’ve been wanting you’re whole life. The staff and chefs are entertaining, the food is unbelievably good and the experience is hands down amazing.

The menu changes, but the quality and flavor is always top notch. If you haven’t experienced the Kitchen, make your reservation today!!

This place is incredible. Amazing service, fantastic food. They make the night so much fun and very memorable! (Depending on how much you drink) Obviously expensive, but worth every penny. You need to experience this at least once in your life.

Fantastic and unique experience ....walking in the kitchen tasting food before we even sat down to eat was a real treat.  At one point I had a glass of champers an oyster and a cookie dough ball!!!  Definately high end cost ($$$$$) but we went all out. Staff were awesome and relaxed...but very efficient.

This is a one of a kind dining experience. A foodie who loves fine dining this food was some of the best ever experienced. Not only is the food worthy of its Michelin rating, the way the meal is presented is super unique. You have an opportunity to be in the kitchen along side the chefs and servers watching the preparation, ask questions, observe plate presentations and watch table service. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly yet non intrusive to the whole experience. Worth every dollar spent.

name: Lucca
reviews: If you want to surprise anyone for a nice dinner. This is the place. Very nice atmosphere. Music is great. Went there during first week of Jan. The outdoors area can be very cozy and warm. Expect to pay more than you are used to. This could easily be a place for a nice romantic dinner.

A large, dark, romantic eatery. For fifteen years excellent meals have been plated for both patio and restaurant seating. As the night is comfortable, we sat on the heated patio.

The appetizer, "Zucchini Chips," is a little like potato chips only so much better. Leah, our server, informed us the chips are vegan and fried in rice brand oil.

The accompany rustic Italian bread is served with both butter and olives oil with balsamic vinegar.

There are four vegan offerings. I selected the stuffed peppers which turned out to be delicious.  A half of both red and yellow peppers are stuffed with rice and white beans, given a kiss of a rich tomato sauce, then sprinkled with arugula. I drizzled a bit of the olive oil/balsamic vinegar bread dip on the arugula.

The meal finished with an incredibly rich raspberry/champagne sorbet.

Everything is wheelchair accessible.

This is a very special restaurant and I highly recommend it.

This is a really nice place to eat in the evening! They got either a nice patio or a dining room you could eat in! The service was really nice and pretty relaxed! The atmosphere was very relaxing, especially with the nice dark wood ceiling and candle lights. The light bulbs stringing around might have been a little to excessive, but the 2 small fountains is what really made the difference! For starters, i ordered the zucchini chips which were a pretty healthy alternative to regular chips! I had the burger for the main entree and it was cooked pretty well and everything from the bun to the lettuce felt fresh and crisp! The fries were salted and seasoned as well! I would come back here if i was in the Sacramento area for dinner! Hopefully they'll keep up their really good service and freshen up the menu!
Very good food! The pork chop is a must have. It's cooked perfectly and is a nice big cut. You can't go wrong here..
Their pasta melts in your mouth. The Risotto dish, was wonderful. All around the restaurant were happy faces. I enjoyed every bite! Will definitely come back to try the other entrees!

name: Bacon & Butter
reviews: Love Bacon & Butter and food is superb but would not recommend takeout during COVID.  They don't open until 9 and then get so many orders that the crowd descends at 9:45 like the website directs but it's another hour before you get your cold food.  I'll be back, but not for takeout - the system is just not organized enough for their level of popularity.  Maybe it would be better on a weekday

Food was good.  Very popular place.  Long wait at 9am on a Saturday, about 30 minutes.  Once seated, food is served fast.  Friendly service.  Warm atmosphere.  I went with my best friend so of course we had a nice time.

The food was excellent. The coffee was fantastic and frequently topped off. The wait was long on a Sunday morning, but totally worth it. I got the kitchen sink it was very good. Friends got the biscuit sandwich and the cinnamon roll and both said they were amazing.
Great service, great food, clean place.  Don't let the long line dissuade you, I have never waited more than 15 minutes to be seated.  I would be willing to wait longer than that to eat here anyway.

We went here for a breakfast date on 02.08.2020. The wait was about 30 minutes for 2 people which isn't bad for this place because it's always busy.

The food was awesome, we tried the chicken and waffles with a side of the house bacon. Drinks were average and personally a fresh orange juice or water or even plain coffee would have sat better.  

The checkbook of poems that you can sign when you're through was a nice touch that we enjoyed and I have photos of the pages we signed.

Pricing was reasonable. If you're willing to wait a bit, I would recommend this place.

name: Biba Restaurant
reviews: The perfect Italian Cuisine experience. Glad the competition was too busy to seat us. Would have never found this gem. Potion sizes are small for a big eater like me but the quality was excellent. With appetizer, meal, and dessert, I was satisfied. Highly recommend.

I have been visiting Biba for a few years and believe their menu and flavors are dynamic and improving. 
The presentation is excellent showing an unlimited creativity.
i believe Biba has done a great job at teaching... viva Bologna!
There's nothing like fresh pasta. The food was good. Great service! Yummy desserts. Fine dining atmosphere.  We like to go there on date nights or birthdays.

The food is amazing! The service is amazing! We had the lasagna last night and the our friend raviolis never was and pesto sauce that was absolutely delicious you cannot go wrong with this restaurant! There's a great tribute to Biba and her family as her Legend lives on!

The service was excellent.  Clean friendly and quick to be seated.  The foods taste was awesome.  The plating and decor could use some updating but overall was a great experience.  If you get a chance stop at the bar first and chat with June.  For an appetizer drinks and two entrees it was only about $150!

name: Kru Contemporary Japanese Cuisine
reviews: Met with some colleagues for dinner. Nice, classy spot with great service all the way around. I ordered the Firecracker Roll and the Lobster Tempura! Both of them were fantastic! Do not hesitate if you like fresh tasty food with an amazing atmosphere. The rest of the group had several different sushi orders, oysters, etc. and they were raving about every bit of it.

Arguably the best place for sushi in Sacramento.   One of the best in Ca.  I usually go for Omekase.  The bar is superb.  Service in the dining room is excellent.  The atmosphere is lively without being frenetic and posh without being forced.  Parking can be a bit dicey but a valet is available.  One of my very favorite restaurants full stop.

Changed from 4 to 5. We went back and the food, service, drinks, atmosphere... could not have been better. The menu rotates enough and servers and knowledgeable on the menu and made great recommendations. Very happy and cannot wait to go back.

Yesterday was our first time in this place. But It is absolutely not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the courteous service, with the magnificent  food and fine drinks and with the honest payment. We will definitely visit there soon.

The decor, food, service and value are all top tier. Everything I've tried here is delicious and fresh. Even the table top seating is nice and comfortable. I haven't sat outside yet, but when walking into the entrance, glancing over at the outdoor seating, it does look very inviting. I'd recommend this place for a romantic dinner, and for a large group, as it has a large room to accommodate around 20 people. Looking forward to returning soon.

name: South
reviews: Always great food and service. The Petey’s Fried Chicken is the best fried chicken I have EVER HAD! And the homemade biscuit with the honey butter is to die for. I also love their wine and beer selection.
Stumbled upon this Southern food dynamo just blocks away from the State Capitol. AMAZING food and service. Between all of us, pretty sure we tried everything. Get here and EAT!

Great food and a cute place. The place has a very relaxed and I pretentious feel. It is light, airy and comfortable. You order your food at the counter and then seat yourself. Service is quick and friendly. The food is fantastic! We had hush puppies to share. They were crispy on the outside and nice and moist on the inside. The homemade buttermilk dressing is out of this world - creamy and flavorful and the perfect dip for the hush puppies. I ordered the fries chicken which again, was perfectly crispy on the outside and moist and flavorful on the inside. The grits were super cheesy but maybe just a tad bit under. That said, I still really enjoyed them. The corn bread had a honey butter glaze. It was good enough to be dessert for me. 

Do yourself a favor and go have a meal at South. You won’t regret it.
Great southern style Staples, huge portions, friendly service. Definitely come here for some tasty food. Recommend the fried chicken, hush puppies, and fried cod.

I give South a 3 star rating because I use a power wheelchair and could not enter into the building without help! It took 2 other people's assistants to get through the door. Because there is a 1"1/2 lip at the door that I could not get over with my power chair! The door does not meet ADA standards! I'd like to thank the 2 people who helped me get Into the building! The food however is outstanding! As is the sweet potato pie! My wife and I sat outside and enjoyed our dinner along side another couple. However another couple who went inside to place their order and left their 2 teenagers outside to sit at their table, were chased off by staff  As I guess you can't keep tables for the rest of your family as they order   food for everyone else. As I said the food is great. However I could not get into the building without help from 2 other people. So we will not be back again!

name: Tower Café
reviews: A great local dining experience. No wait to be seated outside at 5 pm, but the time we left there was a short wait for people arriving (and more limited parking). We ordered Dutch mushrooms and Polynesian guacamole, both were incredible. Portion sizes leave you with leftovers. I  was very happy with my fish and chips. Save room for dessert!

The host was very nice, there was no wait to be seated. Our server took a while to come by our table to even greet us. My food was good, this is the second time I ordered an omelette here. I wish they had a create your own omelette option.

The food was delicious. All 10 people in our group enjoyed their selection. The service was excellent, fast and efficient. Atmosphere was relaxed. I like the fact that they posted at the table not to exceed 90 minutes is awesome. It was a great experience all the way.

WOW! This place NEVER disappoints. There’s a reason there’s a wait to get seated! The service is always friendly. Quality and taste of food is on point. A staple for Sacramento! I always bring my out of town guests here!

I eat in this lovely spot quite often! This is the best place to grab a bite.  I visit this spot at least once a month. The cooking is very good, the crew is professional and the charge is decent. I enjoy eating in this restaurant to have a rich lunch.

name: Ella Dining Room & Bar
reviews: This restaurant is absolutely one of the most pleasant restaurants in the area. Always when I go there I am extremely glad. They always keep their high  level service and the highest level of dishes  they give. You can never go wrong with this place. Highly  recommended.

My boyfriend and I went out for an early Valentine's Day dinner to Ella and I am so glad we made that decision! We ordered the Shrimp cocktail and Bone Marrow for appetizers and it was delicious! Afterwards we had the Tomahawk steak with the golden potatoes and we barely finished it. Everything was so delicious and the staff was superb. It's best to make reservations right away! There's parking across the street at the Hyatt or there's Valet. All in all it was such a great experience and a wonderful evening! Definitely recommend for a night out and good eats.

The food, atmosphere, staff - everything is phenomenal. I can’t recommend this place highly enough for a special dinner out! 

While nothing in the menu is specifically listed as gluten free, many dishes were naturally gluten free or we were able to modify it to be served gluten free.

This place is my number one restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I feel like having a fair meal, this is the place that comes first to my head. very good and   food and a large menu.courteous team, and pleasant atmosphere. In addition to that, the price is reasonable. I suggest this place with great pleasure.

Perhaps one of my favorite places to eat at. Did a birthday dinner this past Friday for my friends birthday. We had a 9pm reservation and had to wait 30 minutes at the bar while waiting for our table. The staff eventually gave us a private room and 3 complimentary appetizers! Wow! We didn't expect that at all! Thank you Ella! Staff and service is bar none.

name: Cafeteria 15L
reviews: Delicious appetizers and entrees, loved the brussell sprouts with bacon... great wait staff, attentive and fast service... fun atmosphere, really big restaurant, weird restroom... it would have been nicer if the hosts in front bid my party of 8 goodnight as we leave the restaurant... definitely coming back for the food!

4.826759
Amazing food that is perfect for all occasions!

Want brunch on the weekend? Need dinner before a concert or basketball game? Just passing through? Cafeteria 15L is the go-to spot that will make you come back again and again!

I've been multiple times, and have always left incredibly happy and satisfied. I highly recommend the Chicken and Waffles, and the chicken is always juicy, and the waffles are perfectly nice and fluffy! Off of the brunch menu, I love the Breakfast Waffle Sandwich, which comes with some of the best potatoes ever.

Seriously, Cafeteria 15L has food for ever occasion and always delivers and excellent meal! I cannot recommend it enough!

This is a very cool place to eat. Very wide open feel. Great staff with excellent food!
You will find something for every taste pallet here!! Very family friendly with reasonable pricing. Great menu selection of just about anything! Delicious!!
Very good!!
Thank you!!

Met a friend here for lunch - delicious food and great service. Our waitress was very kind and on her game. Lots of light and the ambiance was cool. Overall a pleasant experience; will definitely be back soon! *Valet parking available .. and the Spicy Ahi Tuna Poke was nothing short of amazing. Also, the mixed greens were on point.

Been to Cafeteria twice in the last 6 months. Was there for lunch one day after a conference. Was super impressed by how fast the food came out, but it was also freshly made. When we went for breakfast, same thing! Their potatoes were delicious. It’s such a great atmosphere, and a pretty cool bathroom as well.

name: Il Fornaio
address: Wells Fargo Center, 400 Capitol Mall, Sacramento, CA 95814, USA
reviews: We've never had a poor experience here... Servers are always VERY professional, VERY knowledgeable... The place is beautiful inside, very high ceilings and very open. Its the perfect place for a romantic date night!

Service was excellent but food was just okay.  We had 2 family appetizers and mm7 entries.  My entree was the Mare or seafood.  It was good but a little too much sauce and mussel quality could have been better.  Overall, it was a good dining experiencw.

Our first time at your restaurant left a lasting impression. First and foremost our waiter paved the way for an incredible dining experience. Jose was very kind and very knowledgeable of the dishes. 
I had mesquite Salmon and Pene. My wife settled in on the lasagna and it will be hard to go back without ordering the same two dishes. The atmosphere and table setting was superb. We will be back ! Complements to Jose and all who made our dining experience over the top!

Food 4 good but not outstanding; Ambiance 5 comfortable space with plenty of seating; Service 5; Reliable go to restaurant when in Sacramento. Call for reservations, the link on Google maps aren't accurate. Save space for dessert!

My family and I had a wonderful time at this location. Our food was delicious and our experience was even better. Kaitlyn was a wonderful server who made our entire dinner smooth, fun, and worthwhile. She was so friendly, it just added to the whole experience. We’ll definitely be back and hope to see her again.

name: Mayahuel
reviews: I love this place! The staff is so knowledgeable, I learn something every time I come (especially about alcohol). The food is extraordinary
Loved the server! He was fabulous; the food was really good too. Very authentic. They could use some sound absorbers in the dining room though. :) Will definitely be back.

From the first moment  you arrive in this place  the waiters give you an enjoyable feeling. Very warm team, it is a kind place to to go out with buddies or with your date. heavenly  cuisine, talented  chief cook and stuff, decent  price and excellent  service. Warmly recommended.

We love Mayahuel! We are from Seattle and found it a few years ago and we come back whenever we’re in Sacramento or passing through. Their food is fresh, beautiful, authentic and mostly delicious and the drink menu is fantastic. They use fresh ingredients and the staff is welcoming
Stopped by to have a drink with my parents for my husband's birthday! Had a great time and tried the watermelon margarita! He loved it and the bartenders were very friendly!!

name: Seasons 52 - Takeout & Delivery Available
reviews: We were seated in less than 2 minutes. Very pleasant server took our order. The first time I have ever seen food sent back. Food arrived quickly maybe to quickly. My scrambled eggs were perfect. As was the chicken fried steak w/gravy, so tender, country potatoes and sour dough toast and regular Coffee was delicious. All in all I'd say food delicious with generous portions, pleasant family atmosphere and friendly staff.  I give Crickets - 5 Star overall.  Gotta try it, you won't be disappointed.
Great restaurant, friendly staff who checked on us regularly to see if we needed anything. The food was great, bathrooms were very clean. Our food arrived quickly. I’d recommend this place.

This has always been the best steak I’ve ever had. I’ve come here about 10 times and always order the steak. It’s packed with flavor. The asparagus did mash potatoes  that come with it is also great. It is a little tricky to park but, the relaxing environment makes up for it. There are candles with sand at each table with a big water fountain in front of the restaurant and the lighting is great for the style of restaurant they have. I love it. It’s the perfect amount of modern mixed with restaurant. The waiters are nice and friendly. The manager even gave my mom a free meal when she did not like the one she ordered before. The prices are a little bit higher than a normal restaurant worth it when the deserts come! The are absolutely amazing. I don’t even know how to describe it. They come to your table and give you a tour of all the deserts they have. My favorite is the key lime with gram cracker crust. This is the perfect restaurant to go on special occasions!

I love this restaurant. The food is amazing, and I love the ambiance. Additionally, they focus on using fresh and healthier ingredients for their dishes. I especially love that aspect. This is my restaurant if choice for special and intimate occasions. If you have not tried it, don't be fooled because it's attached to a mall. You will not be disappointed. I can't wait for my next opportunity to dine at Seasons 52.

The ambiance of the restaurant is really nice. Our server was great,  super kind and patient. The food left a little more to be desired. Chef was very light on the seasoning. Although it was good,  it could have had some more flavor. Don't know that I'll be back...maybe to try some appetizers but that's probably it.

name: Ryujin Ramen House
reviews:
One of the best Ramen place in Sac. Service was quick and food is yummy! I have been here three times and great service and tasty food every time.

Service: 5
Atmosphere:5 
Cleanliness: 5
Value for money: 5
Food Taste: 5
Recommendation: must visit for yum ramen.

This place amazed me! It’s almost as if they don’t abide by the laws of physics. 

I’ve been going here before and service is always consistently good, but today just blew me away. This place must be very well managed and staff is extremely well trained.

It started when we were seated. It was busy and several people were in front of us, but the receptionist found way to find us and get us to sign in.

We sat down and before I could even warm my seat up they already had a table ready despite how packed the place was.

After seating us they got our order within a minute.

What amazed me was it felt like as soon as I gave the server my order, I took one glance at my phone I looked up and the food was ready in an instant.

It really amazed me.

The people to might left, and as soon as they stood up, the busboy took the plates, cleaned the table and got it ready within a minute or so. 

Staff was friendly enough and very attentive. Everything went like clockwork. The lady was able to check on us several times despite how busy the place was.

I’ve seen so many other restaurants encounter the same kind of rush hour traffic and they start struggle and Ryujin just cruises through it.

Really great job to the management and the staff. Keep it up.
Tried this place in the past with a friend and I am obsessed ever since. I liked the great atmosphere and yummy food and beverages. I recommend this place.

Favorite ramen place in Sacramento that I’ve been too.  Great selection of broths and toppings and everything I’ve tried has been delicious.

They have a sister store across the street that serves ramen versions with thicker types of broth but I prefer the lighter types. 

Can be a bit crowded at certain time and parking can take a small bit of extra time, but well worth the effort.
Absolutely love this place! This is by far the best ramen in town. The service is great as well, they're very fast and friendly

name: Mikuni | Midtown Sacramento
address: 1530 J St STE 150, Sacramento, CA 95814, USA
reviews: Unbelievably good sushi!!  A little pricey (actually, very pricey...at least for my budget), but it was such better sushi than what we can get in our neck of the woods.  Very attentive and friendly server.  Great atmosphere.  Loved it for a special date night!  Highly recommend!

We met with friends at this restaurant for dinner. my friend recommended this spot.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff welcomed us with a smile and we felt good. The meal was great. We had a great time and we shall absolutely come back again. Recommended.

This is some great, high quality sushi. The main dining room is a bit loud for my taste and always packed. While this is good for their profit and I'm happy they are busy, I wouldn't recommend taking a group here with the intention of having a deep conversation.

I meet with friends this lovely spot  a lot! This is my favorite spot to grab a bite.  I go there at least once a month. The food is just great, the staff is professional and the payment is affordable. I enjoy eating in this restaurant over a good dinner.

This is certainly one of the best place to eat in the area. Always when I come to this place I am deeply pleased. They maintain their very high  level service and the topmost level of dishes  they serve. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. Very  recommended.

name: Tres Hermanas
reviews: Amazing little Mexican spot with a diverse menu, and delicious margaritas! The place is small so expect a wait on busy nights, grab a drink from the bar while you wait. We had a veggie burrito and ceviche... Both delicious, but huge portions! We could have easily shared. New favorite spot, we will definitely be back!

Don't confuse this place with Three Sisters on Folsom. There is a BIG difference in the quality of food, service, and ambiance. This place is fantastic! If you're in Midtown and want some authentic Mexican cuisine, do yourself a favor and check out Tres Hermanas!

My niece loves this place so we went to check it out. For the most part it was an ok experience. I'd like to try it again during a less busy time. Our waitress seemed in a hurry everytime she came to the table and didn't make it back with whatever we'd have time to quickly ask for until she'd come again to the table and be reminded of what we'd asked for. The food was delicious and quite tasty. I left very full. Possibly more from those delicious chips they give while you wait😁

Excellent Mexican food regardless of what you get. Small but homey with friendly staff. If you go, definitely get the salsa and chips. They are all hand made that day. It doesn't get any better  than that.
Always a hit. And they don't use lard. The food and the service is good every single time I visit.

name: Bangkok@12 Thai
reviews:
BANGKOK ORANGE CHICKEN - Chicken breast in light batter, fried to golden brown, and topped with homemade orange sauce, bedding with vegetables.

PORK PAD SEE- EW -  stir fried with rice noodle, egg, broccoli and carrot in sweet soy sauce.

CHICKEN PAD THAI - Rice stick noodles stir fried with choice of meat, egg, tofu, bean sprout, green onion in Pad Thai sauce, topped with ground peanut.

POT STICKER - Deep fried ground chicken and vegetables wrapped in sealed dough, served with sweet and sour soy sauce.

BEEF GARLIC LOVER - Stir fried your choice of meat in garlic and pepper, served with sliced cucumber.

Came here for dinner before a show at the Community Center, and was pleasantly surprised. The vegetarian fried spring rolls were delicious, as was the vegetarian spicy eggplant. The eggplant was different than what I've had at most other Thai restaurants--it was more of a broth than a sauce--but let me tell you, that broth was DELICIOUS. I could have had a bowl full of the stuff.

I'd definitely come back here again.

The food is so yummy. Servers are pretty friendly but there is zero sense of urgency. I spent 90 min here during lunch. It took forever to get my food. I came at noon. After I got my food I had to ask for the check and a box. No one ever came to get the check. It's like they forgot about me again. Unfortunately I'll be back because the food is good and it's close to my job.

I've been coming here for years, and this place always offers great customer service and consistent quality. I recently brought a work group of 17 people. I called ahead, they set up a nice space, and they even split up all the checks without even being asked, which I thought was nice and above and beyond. Every single person was happy with their food, which is a miracle in and of itself!
A fresh and delicious food. Place was good. Services was great.

name: Aïoli | Bodega Española
reviews:
I cant even begin to tell you. Live acoustic music. Beautiful setting, amazing wait staff. The owner greets you and seats you at your table. The food was out of this world. Awesome drink selection to choose from. Just a wonderful evening out. 
Eat with confidence.

This place exceeded all expectations. Ambiance was sweet and romantic; the service was the best I've ever received, and the food was delicious. The wine was great too! My husband and I will be returning soon, so great.

The lighting and decorations were great we sat at the bar because it was a little bit packed for the time we went. No complaints there

We were instantly greeted and the bartender really cater to our needs.  He explained the menu and listened to our wants and was very conversational and compassionate.

The food was very good and quickly plated, I am a meat eater whilst my girlfriend doesn’t partake in eating meat. We both found something we could eat and be satisfied with.

The prices are affordable and the serving sizes are moderate, so if you’re looking for a cozy place to grab a Tapa in downtown Sacramento give this place a go

Great food, but I didn't like how fancy the place was. Fancy restaurants always make me feel bad about myself, I never think I'm good enough to be eating there. I would have preferred if the same food was served at an establishment that looked more run down, like IHOP or something. To try and mask my insecurities, I ended up having a bit too much wine. I got to the point where I was talking too loudly, but was also aware enough to realize I was talking too loudly. I kept apologizing for talking too loudly before anyone even told me to lower my voice. It was like every time I spoke, I surprised myself by how loud it was. It would have been nice to have been a bit more drunk, then I couldn't have realized how obnoxious I was actually being. The tables around us must have been grateful when our food arrived because then I couldn't talk as much. My dad and I ended up splitting the paella. He felt it was very salty, I thought it was too, but it was perfect for me because I love salt. Overall, we had a good time, but I can't say the same for the tables around us.

Best tapas place in Sac. Their paella is bomb. Takes 25mins to cook, please order it with your apps order. Totally worth the wait!

Update (2/9/20): stopped by for dinner again. Loved it again. Amazing service and awesome taste as always. This time around I ordered paella the moment I sat down as it takes 30mins to prep. Had scallops, lamb, ahi tuna tartare. Please check pics!

name: Rio City Cafe
reviews: We ordered dinner to go tonight and Rio City really delivered. Super friendly on the phone and at pick up, asked questions to make sure we were getting everything we wanted, AND offered us G&T’s to go in little cardboard soup containers!  The food was fabulous. Give them some business during quarantine, they deserve it.

We stopped in late after attending a live performance. The lights were on, but we didn't see too many people. As it turns out, they were mostly sitting on the covered patio along the banks of the Sacramento river. We were quickly seated and informed of the night's specials, which we didn't have. My brother in law (BIL) had the fish and chips. I had jambalaya, and my wife had a sirloin steak. Everyone liked their meal. The service was good, the employees friendly and the atmosphere, pleasant. I would return to this restaurant and encourage you to give it a try.

Fantastic view of the Sacramento River and the marina. The food is very good and well priced. Happy hour is a must do with plenty of food and drink specials. Rio City Cafe is where you should go if you're visiting. With its close proximity to old Sacramento there is plenty to do.
We had a wonderful dinner. The server was very attentive from the moment we walked in till we left. Food was very good. Would highly recommend it.

We were so disappointed in the service we received, or I should say,  "lack of service". We got one of the worst servers we've ever had. She waited on all the tables around us and completely ignored us. We had asked for water several times and she never brought it. We saw her visiting with her coworker for about 10 minutes and then she brought water to other tables in front and behind us.  When I tried to get her attention she snapped at me and said she would get to our table when she was finished waiting on the other tables. She was horrible! We I had asked her to refill our empty water cup several times and she didn't do it. She was not only rude, but then she went to the table behind us and started talking to them about us. For that reason we will not be returning. We were so disappointed due to the horrible service by this particular server. She needs more training.

name: Dawson's Steakhouse
reviews: This site is my first choice site.  Of all restaurants I know I prefere it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to visit this restaurant. when  I want to go to a good meal, this restaurant comes immediately to my mind.  Great and all sorts of  food and a rich cuisine.professional staff, and agreeable spirit. Not less important, the charge is modest. I sent my friends to this spot with great pleasure.
We started at the bar with  Dawson's Manhattan drink.   Moved to the table and we had an amazing dinner and drinks, our waiter Brandon was the best!!!

I celebrated my PhD yesterday in this excellent restaurant. I am glad to say that we passed a awesome evening and the venue was unquestionably the reason for the successful event. The crew  cooperated in a lovely way, the food was yummy and my friends were extremely  pleased. We shall no dout come back again for more joyful events. Thank you very much.

For the price of the dishes I expected a lot more. A friend made the reservation and for a restaurant in a hotel I was shocked by the prices on the menu. I admit I ordered the cheapest entree on the menu, which is out of the ordinary. I ordered the burger without lettuce. The burger showed us with lettuce which was disappointing but easy to remove but the flavor of the meat was not worth $20.00 for a burger. A known CA burger joint known for an easy in n out would tastes a lot better and has a lot less grease.

Food quality, taste, and service was all far under what it should be for the cost. When we arrived we waited 10 minutes for anyone to acknowledge we were there. No it was not busy and I had eye contact with the bar tender two different servers. Finally one server said hello and they will get the host. Another five minutes waiting and I believe the manager sat us without even apologizing for making us wait and having none up front. 

Next the food was bland and dry. Our steaks lacked flavor and tasted as if they were previously frozen. My rid eye had no marbling throughout the steak which is very odd for a rib eye. The lobster tail was undercooked and had the flavor of tap water and the texture of instant mashed potatoes. 

If you are going to spend 300 bucks for dinner there are so many other places where you'd get better food and way better service.

name: Burgers and Brew
reviews: The food was great, everything came out super quick and they had vegetarian accomodations which was nice. The burgers were really flavourful and had a good amount of toppings but weren't overflowing which was nice. The French Fry Nachos (w/ no meat) we had as an appetizer were great and had a lot of salsa and guacamole on them. The salsa and guacamole were seasoned and rated fresh. They also had really nice fries that were kinda crispy and paired nicely with their ranch.

Delicious burgers and fries. Parking can be found on the street or a structure. We ordered Greek burger, avocado burger (generous portion of avocado), and New England fries (clam chowder/bacon/cheddar). We had the sweet potato fries and onion rings and both were quite delicious. I have been to many places where the burgers are good, but fries are decent, but this place has both. Finished it off with a strawberry shake which was fairly simple and basic and nothing super special. Would come again if we ever in Sac Town.
Customer service was great and the food was decent enough. Great beer selection too! I had the chowder fries (highly recommend) the buffalo burger and sweet potato fries. All pretty decent.
We had a fantastic experience in this spot. We enjoyed the wonderful environment and the food. The staff members are very amiable. I am glad we ultimately decided to try this restaurant.

First time here with my daughter and her friend.

It is a pretty good size place and was so busy. Showed up around 6. We got seated immediately.  Our drink order was taken right away.

It is a very cozy place.

I ordered the pastrami burger with onion rings and my daughter the hickory cheddar burger with garlic curly fries.

We both really liked the burgers. They were the bomb. The garlic curly fries were amazing. Onions rings hot and crispy.

I would for sure come back.😊😊😊

name: Canon | East Sacramento
reviews:
The food here is exploding with flavor! It's served family style so you can share and sample a handful of dishes. The menu changes regularly, giving you plenty of opportunities to try something new. I loved the barbecue carrots.

This place is perfect for everything from a romantic evening out to a celebratory dinner to a get together with friends to a quick stop to get dessert. Personally, I'm going to find every excuse to stop by.

The dessert is out-of-this-world! Make sure you save room.

The staff are fantastic! They're friendly, professional, and the work together to provide an elegant dining experience. You truly feel like you can relax while they take care of your every need. My water glass was never more than half empty. 

If you are looking for the full dining experience, this place will not disappoint.

Really delicious! Went here with my boyfriend for Valentine's day. Highly recommend the oxtail. It literally melts in your mouth. Best thing on the menu. P.S. their menu changes like every 6 months. Oh and their pineapple/basil cocktail is strong but doesn't taste like alcohol at all -- dangerous but good!

Well crafted cocktails.  Good wine list at very reasonable prices including a nicely put together wines by the glass.  Good selection of beers.  Service is efficient.  Space is a very loud, so certainly not romantic.  Good is artfully presented but the quality of the ingredients and the execution falls short.  At this price point, you should receive balanced nuanced flavors.  Instead, most dishes were over salted and reflective of a single note.  Dessert was a complete disappointment.  Nothing local or sustainable on the menu, oddly.

The food, service, and atmosphere were all phenomenal. There wasn't a thing that our group ordered that wasn't delicious. The crispy Brussels sprouts were especially outstanding and the banana cheesecake dessert was really special. I would never have thought that Szechuan pickled pineapple would taste so amazing.

We finally made it to Canon and we can’t wait to go back! The food was fantastic. Our duck was perfectly cooked. The consommé was unctuous and flavorful. The dessert was also a standout. Definitely worth a visit!

name: The Pilothouse
reviews: Honestly, I was confused. The meal started with a Mediterranean meatball, then a Cajun risotto. It was awkward to walk into. The dining room had 8 diners at 6:30pm. They stacked all customers on top of each other, even though there was plenty of seating. My risotto was bland and was all kind of one note. Could’ve really used some acid. The dessert was fine. I don’t understand putting a a whole leaf of mint as a garnish, it’s pointless. If you want mint in the dish then incorporate it. This should’ve been a great dining experience. Historic location with great ambiance, except no music to drown out some of the loud chewing from the other tables. That said, the bar seemed to be popping and I really regretted eating in the dining room

The food is so good!!!  Coming from LA we have plenty of great food joints but I will put the pilothouse food up against any steakhouse in LA . Great stake and crunchy flavorful potatoes. Risotto was creamy and so so good.

This was a lot of fun. I think the experience we had was a little better than the food. The Queen, the river, Old Sac were all part of a very nice experience. We had great food and the services was pleasant. I would come back.

I like to go with friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are delicious and the team is generous and cooperative. always when we go to this place we enjoy a lovely time.  warmly recommended.
Great food. Super Hostess.   Great views. Great evening

name: Magpie Café
reviews: The veggie hummus bowl is great. Surprisingly hearty and filling. The veggies have a nice char but remain crunchy. The hummus brings all the flavors together and makes what could be a sad flavorless dish into something special. Good service and a nice atmosphere. A good date restaurant.

Dined for our 16th year anniversary. Very relaxed atmosphere, we opted for alfresco dining. 
Our server, Jen was awesome. She knew when to come and when to give us our space. 
The food was delicious as always. Reminds one of home and a warm hug from Dad. 
See pics for what we ordered. 
An awesome start to our anniversary week off! 
Thanks Magpie Cafe, we will be back.
Food was great. Drinks were fabulous. Service was a little slow.

This place was great! I got the hummus and vegetable bowl with a 6 minute egg. The egg was perfect and creamy. The humus was delicious and creamy. The vegetables were all deliciously seasoned and crispy not soggy. The sourdough bread that came with the dish as well was tasty. Wish I could have tried more, will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

One of my fave brunch places! Magpie has fresh, healthy ingredients. Their selection is great! I have loved every single thing I’ve ever had there. Addicted to their house-made granola. Love their avocado toast. Great view of the park and a fun outdoor patio. A must try if you haven’t been there yet! Just talking about it is making me hungry! Can’t wait for Saturday, think I know where I’m gonna be eating breakfast. 

Dinners are great too! Their pork tenderloin is melt in your mouth! I typically eat brunch here but I’m sure their dinners are all just as delicious!

name: Frank Fat's
reviews: Finally made it to Frank Fat's downtown location. A group of us stopped by for dinner after a conference and they were able to quickly accommodate us. Everything is ordered family style, so we got 5-6 dishes for the six of us. It was just the right amount for everyone and we finished all the dishes. Everything was delicious and full of flavor. The staff were wonderful, from the hostess helping my friend get gum off his crutch to the server checking in the perfect amount. I also placed a separate order to go and it was done very quickly.

Excellent experience at Frank Fats. We were in town for a conference and stopped for lunch before heading home. The food was excellent, and the service terrific. Everyone was engaging and helpful. There were 4 of us and we all ordered different dishes - everyone loved their food. Will definitely visit the next time we are in town.

We were lucky to get a table without a reservation. The ambiance was good, staff was very friendly, food was good. We especially liked the spring rolls and immigrant beef. The banana cream pie was awesome. I would definitely go back.

Travel to Sacramento a lot for work and this has become a staple for delicious food every time. Highly recommend the honey walnut shrimp and the immigrant beef. The restaurant itself is really beautiful, art deco asian decor along with some items with history behind them. The menu tells you more about them which is really cool.

I celebrated my PhD last night in this fine place. Well we passed a sensational evening and the venue was undoubtedly one of the reasons for that strong evening. The team  helped in a graceful style, the cooking was extremely good and my friends were very  pleased. We shall no dout visit again for more events. thanks very much.

name: Pushkin's Restaurant
reviews: Beautiful place, super vegan friendly! My friends loved it. There’s a bit of a wait so I recommend reserving a spot around 30 min before (depending on what day you come, we went on a Saturday and it was PACKED) the service was absolutely amazing! My waiter literally made a sauce (Francis I think his name was) like combined a couple of sauces to make me a honey mustard sauce🤧super sweet guy & super genuine. I was happy with my meal but expected a little more, maybe I just not a very big breakfast sandwich gal but I’ll 100% be comming back to maybe try their chicken & waffles or a different brunch item! (Nice bathrooms as well, sinks are public)

How did I not know about this place!  Everything is gluten free.  So many delicious options.  The staff were very friendly and informative.  Weekends expect a 20-30 minute wait to be seated.  Worth it!

Got there at about 8am, so just beat the Saturday morning brunch rush by a hair!  I love the open atmosphere and fresh ingredients.  Food should feel good in a body, and my deconstructed lox fit the bill!  Had a brown sugar latte as well, which was not as sweet as I expected, but exactly as sweet as I'd hoped.

I’ve been here a couple times now and the food is very good for gluten free food. Comparing the food to normal, gluten-full food, it would fall short. But keeping the category strict to gluten free, it’s definitely at the top. I’d warn hungry visitors that it is often a 30+ wait to get a seat and then a good long wait for them to bring out the food from the time you order.

Always worth a stop even if I'm not staying in or near Sacramento. If I'm even somewhat nearby I make a point to stop here. The best gluten free vegan options I've ever seen in a restaurant. They're also so clean and modern it's really a beautiful spot. We LOVE pushkins!

name: Café Rolle
reviews: Went there for lunch with my brother since he knows the owner and what can I say french food. I had the prawn sandwich which was perfect . Prawns were cooked right and break was slightly warm and crunchy. The waiter ( wish I got his name) was excellent and very professional. We did get the lunch special which include a drink and dessert ( we picked of course an orangina and creme brulee) . Will definitely come back!
Simply the best ham sandwich I have had! Sriracha ham and Gruyere. The bread was amazing.
Fabulous foods, excellent and cosy services. Had a great time here.

Cafe Rolle is my favorite French restaurant of choice in Sacramento. You will not find another with more delicious sandwiches, both hot and cold than from Cafe Rolle. Please try the hot duck Pate sandwich. It melts in your mouth!

This is a nice little place. Gets busy right away once they open up. Food is fresh and tasty. Lively and friendly service. Parking is limited but possible, many Park down the street and walk back to the cafe.

name: Paesanos Midtown
reviews: This place is buzzing. Very busy, but still quiet and intimate enough to enjoy your meal. There mostly is a  waiting time, but you get a buzzer to warn you when your table is ready. The food was not that expensive and tasted absolutely wonderful. The wine was great for its price and the staff was friendly. Definitely recommend!

This place is great! Lots of gluten free options decent service and not over priced.  Food tastes great nice and hot. Its a very rustic feel in the building. Kinda 80s and r&b music playing. Would definitely come again.

You can never go wrong with the shrimp scampi! Any pizza here is good and the tortellini is perfect also.  top off your meal with a picture of their amazing sangria and you will have an outstanding dinner experience.

two days ago was the first time in this restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We enjoyed the evening very much with the attentive service, with the first-rate  meal and booze and with the decent payment. We will absolutely go back there soon.
Amazing vibes and very attentive service. The meals were fresh and delicious. Will clearly recommend this place to friends and family. Convenient rates and generous portions. Good job.

name: Mamma Susanna's Ristorante Italiano
reviews: Would be better if they were open more than 3 1/2hrs a day. Haven't had the chance to try...I WORK. Today I had the day off and passed by. The kitchen was dark and empty, pots and pans sitting idol. How can you make good Italian food w/o simmering through the day...before 3pm? I'm guessing all sauces are Costco frozen and warmed just before opening. Just boil some noodles and call it good?

Wonderful experience here, I was with a party of 6, and they let us place a reservation for 6 people at 8pm, an hour before they closed and were extremely accommodating to our party.

The food was great and we had no complaints with the service.
Just the way it should be. Simple atmosphere wit great food and service. I will return.
Great little spot, big portions and small prices! Find a great deal on groupon!
Good food, extremely friendly staff!  They serve classic Italian fare at decent prices.  Would definitely eat here again!

name: The Porch Restaurant & Bar
reviews:
Delightful mid-town eatery. Unique menu printed up daily--today's focus: Southern. Our group of four put a decent dent into sampling the selection. Not one disappointment. One happy customer here.

Do be sure to order the Purple Cow Cake!

['19/11 1st try/review]

I was SO not impressed with their food. I sat in the bar area and the best thing about this place was the bartender who took my order. He was very nice, talkative, and engaging. The food, on the other hand, left so much to be desired. The presentation of the food and portion sizes were plentiful and mouthwatering; however, the food did not taste good. The flavors were odd and extremely disappointing. I ordered the Roasted Brussels, an appetizer, and they were probably the best tasting of all the other dishes I ordered. I also ordered the Candied Yams; there was absolutely NOTHING candied about them. Yes they had brown sugar and marshmallows, but they were NOT sweet or bared any tasty resemblance to the candied yams I was raised on. I also ordered the Collard Greens. SMH. Maybe some people like their collards sour, or tart, but I do not. I like collard greens, not mustard greens, which are usually more sour than collards. I was VERY disappointed. Lastly, I ordered the Apple Walnut Slaw. Again, disappointing. However, it has a vinegar base and not mayonnaise, so that may have been why I wasn't a fan. Finally, they charged me $3 more than what the menu indicated, which is weird when their menu changes frequently. Ultimately, I took the food with the intent to give it to a homeless person, and lo and behold, there was a young man with a sign reading, "Just Hungry," near the Arden Fair shopping area. Just his luck tonight. I probably won't be coming back unfortunately. I was hoping the food would have been better.

Charming place that is actually bigger on the inside than how it looks on the outside. There is a variety of brunch and side menu options. You can go basic or try a specialty item.  Their menu does change depending on what they have in store. If you find this on their menu when you're there,  you have to try their cornbread. It was so good,  put some butter and jelly on it and let it explode in your mouth.  Yum yum yum!Parking can be a challenge but just be patient, and you'll find a spot. This place is like stepping on your grandma's porch.

Southern charm and decor to match. Everything looked really appetizing from the menu. Nice to go with groups. Had the shrimp pirlo and it was great. Wanted to try the chicken but was told that would always be on the menu and went for a seasonal option. Will be back to try other choices. Service was excellent as well.

this place has a full bar with a good selection. The staff are friendly but the food was just ok. There's a good selection of all the fried food you could ever want. Fried chicken with unseasoned. The vegan meatballs had a tangy sauce but crumbled when as you eat it. There was quinoa everywhere. Just really hard to eat.

name: Fixins Soul Kitchen
reviews: FYI: this visit was about three weeks after they opened. It was a busy Saturday afternoon. We waiting for a party of 10 about 15 min. We called ahead of time and let them know what time we were coming but unfortunately they had to split is up to accomadate the size. The waiter was good and are good came in a very reasonable time. I wad taking back a bit by the pricing but taste wise I can't complain. I haven't had the flavor combo of the green tomatoes since I left the south. My chicken was crispy and tender. The parking out front is very limited but they have overflow parking around the corner next to the bookstore. The bar has television but the outside seating was not being used on my visit.

There has been a bit of a buzz with this place. It's definitely worth every bit of the hype. We did have to wait about 15min for a table but that's expected when a place like this is so popular. I tried the pimento cheese dip which was meltingly good. The fried chicken was so darn crispy on the outside and so tender on the inside. The hot chicken sandwich is like the name says, hot. But a good hot. The Mac and cheese and potato salad were delicious as well! I can't wait to come back to have more chicken. And try the other sides.

The chicken is fine. 
The mac & cheese is fine. 
The beans and rice are fine. 
What isn't even fine was the $10 peach cobbler soup. It was liquid when in a plastic container. There were bits of pie crust dumped in it. I didn't want deconstructed peach cobbler soup. $10!

It was our first time here and I will definitely be back.  Started off with the deep fried deviled eggs, the filling was great, as for the white being deep fried, not necessary.  The catfish was light and the cornmeal batter was flavorful.  I don't like hush puppies much anyway, these were fine.  The Mac and cheese was very good with lots of good cheesey flavor.  The collard greens were excellent, only place I have found around here that makes them as good as my wife, these were sweeter than hers, but a very close second.  I would come back for a big bowl of these.  My daughter had chicken strips, 4 big pieces and fries, they were good.  My wife had the shrimp and grits, 5 or 6 big shrimp in a delicious sauce that got spicier the more you ate it.  The service was great, our waitress was busy, but did an awesome job.  We will definitely be coming back, I want to try the rest of the menu.  The best southern food we have had in Sacramento.  Keep up the good work.

Love the food. Came out pretty fast too. The only reason that I did not give 5 stars because of the slow service. We actually got all of our food too before we got our drinks. I think our server forgot about it. Had to asked another server for it.

name: Empress Tavern
reviews: The Empress Tavern is an intriguing and mysterious experience. It is tucked neatly underground, next to the Crest Theater on Downtown K Street. At first, we didn't even know where the entrance was. It's really mysterious. When you are in the restaurant, it feels like you are in a secret vampire cave! The food is exceptional. Try the Beef Stroganoff. The bread is also yummy. The staff is friendly too. Try out this hidden gem!

I never rate anything 5 stars unless its the best. This place was amazing. The location, the atmosphere, the staff. Staff ushered us to our reserved table promptly. Wait staff never let our water or drink glasses go close  to empty.  Food was amazing, from the appetizer to dessert, i was overly impressed with everything

This place is obviously one of the most attractive restaurants in the region. Anytime I come to this place I am awfully pleased. They preserve their very high  level service and the highest level of food  they serve. You definitely will enjoy this this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

This spot is the one I always prefer. I go to a lot of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very chummy and the cuisine they place on your table is so yummy. I never decline to have a decent dinner in this restaurant. I highly recommend this place.

I gave this restaurant 3 stars because i liked the beautiful brickwork. The inside is worth seeing. 
The food was okay for the price. The beef cheek stroganoff was okay the biggest twist being the dill. I was happy that the meat was tender, Not chewy and did not have gristle.  
My husband loved the scallops and said they were the best he's had in a long time.  
Our dinner friends had the fried chicken which they said was breaded well and very tender. 
All of us agreed that our favorite part was the artichoke dip appetizer which came with crunchy potato chips.  Even my husband liked it,  (he usually does not because restaurants often leave the chewy harder leaves in with the dip which he doesn't care for),  but here it was diced tender leafy creamy perfection. 
I thought the price was way too steep for the food, and it was very very loud. The waiter left much to be desired.  But.... we all really did enjoy going and loved seeing this building as well.
I also appreciated that the bathrooms were very clean and had lots of room.
We loved that this place was so close to the theater. (We were attending a show later so it made it easy)

name: Allora - Italian Restaurant
reviews: The food was simply amazing. All of the dishes were obviously given the utmost thought! From the beginning appetizers to the main course the dinner had flow you know what I mean. Everything came to our table at the perfect moment. The food was only to be matched by the fabulous service that was given. Heck of a way to spend our anniversary. Thank you so very much!!

Pretentious manger not worth your time

Giving 2 stars not because of the food but the lack of customer service.  We (my girlfriend and I) walked in on a Monday night and to our surprise it wasn't very busy.  A few tables open, no one at the bar, and multiple tables finishing up, and seemed like a mellow night.  The hostess was nice quickly helping us and asked if we had a reservation, I replied no but looks like you guys aren't very busy.  The manager walks over and starts messing with the computer when I over heard him tell her that it would be a 25 minute wait.  Uh a 25 minute wait huh?  He looked at me with a very pretentious look and I felt like walking out immediately, but the hostess offered us a seat at the bar, which I didn't care for but we sat anyways.  Food was decent and our server was great.  The manager came to deliver our food and served us the wrong food..... nice one bud.  As we finished our dinner at the bar I couldn't help but notice not one person sat at the tables he said were reserved (multiple)

We came to this restaurant for dinner. we heard about this place from many people.  Well, it was a winning. the staff were so friendly and we felt very good. The food was just great. We enjoyed every moment and we will visit this place again. Highly recommended.

Gourmet Italian food with great taste, but selection and size can be lacking. Parking is on the street only unless you're handicapped where there's one space in the back, so parking can be challenging when busy. Main dining area echos a lot so having a conversation with your table is very difficult when there's a loud drunk party across from you. Oysters were fresh and excellent. Overall, service was friendly but understaffed so our waiter was ultra busy while other staff helped out. If possible I'd give an extra half star for a 4.5 star rating because I still enjoyed my dinner here with friends!
Modern take on Italian. Emphasis on seafood but also has a separate vegetarian menu (be sure to ask for it!) The wait staff was attentive and friendly. Large wine selection. Chic / clean ambiance

name: Public House Downtown
reviews: Tried this place tonight. We got the Philly cheese steak and prosciutto pizza. The food was amazing! Great quality ingredients and the service was great. Not bad pricing at all for what you get. We will definitely return.

We visited here on a Saturday afternoon before a concert at Golden One. We were seated quickly and our server Tonya gave us great service. Both the beer and food were very good. Plenty of seating and nearby parking.

This place is the one I like best. I go to a lot of restaurants but to this place I keep coming back again and again. The stuff is very welcoming and the cooking they place on your table is so yummy. I never miss an opportunity to have a good dinner in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

I visited this place for a girls night out and loved it. The ambiance and food is great. Great for a date night or just hanging out with friends or watch the game. I am a beer fan and loved their options for beer. Must try the monkey ale beer :)

Great place to meet for lunch or dinner. The menu has large variety. Some of my favorites include the grilled salmon salad and the wild mushroom pizza. The beer is always fresh and delicious! The waitstaff is very knowledgeable and attentive. I come here every time I am in Sacramento.

name: The Melting Pot - Sacramento
reviews: The wait staff here is some of the best, and most enjoyable people i have had as servers. The food is super fresh. You cook it yourself at the table if course! Also, bring your appetite because this will be an eating experience like no other. We ordered the yin&yang martinis throughout the night and loved it all! Can't wait to go back.

The food was just okay. Nothing that I’d return for, even at half the price. The service was slow and our server was not very attentive. I was expecting a 2 hour experience but watched other servers get their tables out a good 30 minutes faster than our server got us out. When you’re waiting for a hot minute between courses, you people watch. Other diners' meals seemed much more seamless. Our server would check on us and we’d be almost finished with a course (maybe 2 pieces of something) and he’d tell us he’d check back in a minute. 15 Minutes later he’d show back up. My husband wanted a cheese fondue but I didn’t. Either I got it or he didn’t. What if someone wanted it who dined alone? They’re stuck with 2 portions? Let’s just say I was not impressed.

Cool place for sure!  Ambiance is amazing and food was even better. Server was on point and treated us newcomers well!  I would have done five stars but wasn’t a big fan of our table. It was in the corner and it felt a bit cramped!  I will be eating here again but will be requesting another location.

Get ready for an experience.  This is dining like nothing you've ever had. First off, let me say that they validate parking,  however,  if there is an event, you may have a harder time finding parking.  We were greeted warmly, and assisted quickly.  The customer service was on point and our drinks were always full. The food was absolutely delicious. You can try the 4 course meal for about $50, or you can pick the courses you want. The entire meal took about 2 hours and it was definitely worth every penny. I suggest making a reservation in advance.

We love the melting pot! We go here for almost every special occasion. The food is wonderful, the service is stellar and it isn't just dinner, it is an experience! Plan to be dining for at least two to three hours. The mood is romantic and upscale, but you'll stool feel comfortable showing up in jeans. The manager Casey is a gem, so if you get a chance to talk to her you will be happy you did!

name: Scott's Seafood on the River
reviews: I would expect a MUCH higher quality from employees here, especially considering that it’s supposed to be a high scale restaurant. Super unfriendly staff. This is the first time we came here to check out the place and were really excited, but have no desire to come back. We entered from the parking area (which is not the main entrance as we figured out later) and didn’t know where to go for the seating, so we came up to the waiters’ station where 2 waiters were standing. We stood there for like a minute - they gave us a weird look once (like why the heck are you standing here), twice, and only then bothered to ask if we need any help. When we came to the host’s stand no one was there. After she came back to her stand she was doing her stuff for some time and only then asked how can she help us. After we found out that they don’t have any tables available due to reservations we went to sit at the bar. Again, waited for some time before the bartender took away previous customers’ empty glasses and threw the napkins for drinks to us.. when we asked for a menu he gave it to us and said that it’s better to hurry up with ordering as they’ll switching the menu in 5 minutes. At this point we felt super uncomfortable with the treatment from all the staff that we just got up and left. Went to a “regular” scale restaurant where apparently all the staff smiles and is being friendly. It just doesn’t make sense - when you go to the high scale restaurant you expect a special kind of service, and it turns out to be completely opposite.

Very tasty. Expensive and SUPER packed. Met good friends for dinner and it was their choice,  we most likely would not have ever been otherwise. If you like a crowd and dont mind spending a pretty penny, I think you'll enjoy this place. If you're frugal and/or like an intimate feel-steer clear.

We like a lot eating out. Yesterday we  visited this magnificent restaurant which friends recommended to us. We had a lovely time there with fine dishes and a well-trained team and a talented chief cook. We  added this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we will certainly come back soon. We highly recommend.

We met with friends at this spot for lunch. This spot was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, we were not disappointed. we were warmly welcomed by the staff members  and we had a great feeling. The meal was great. We loved this place a lot and we shall definitely come back again. Highly recommended.

The atmosphere was spectacular, our food was flavorful, beautifully presented and took a reasonable amount of time. We also sampled a few different cocktails and enjoyed all of them, and Miguel our server was friendly, attentive and mindful of our needs. If you want somewhere to go for a special occasion, make a reservation and you won't be disappointed.

name: Zocalo Restaurant Midtown
reviews: Unfortunately my photo of my dinner didn’t come out, but the food was fantastic! Just the right sized portions. The staff was very pleasant, and that atmosphere was great. I’d highly recommend if you’re in the area!

I have been to many places downtown and mid town and have never come across a place as unique and as welcoming as this restaurant. the bartenders and staff are amazing and the food is so delicious, I cannot recommend any other place but this. this will soon become your most favorite and cherished place to visit and eat from.
Great mid-town location.  Good food and good service.  Extensive drink menu and lots of great tequila choices.  If you like a little quieter, choose the outdoor patio
Best pitcher of margaritas I have ever had and the food was excellent! Super busy Friday night yet we had amazing service and they were extremely fast. New favorite place!

Beautiful restaurant and bar with soaring high ceilings. We were there for a catered party and the service was excellent, but I did not get to choose or see their menu. Great margaritas & fancy street tacos, delicious guacamole. VERY loud inside.

name: Hook and Ladder Manufacturing Company
reviews: If you want a 10/10 atmosphere this is the place. We got dinner and drinks here and the only spot they lost points were in the drinks. We sat at the bar before getting seat and order some from the bartender. They were tasty but had no traces of alcohol in their mules, kind I’d disappointing to say the least. Food was great as well as the service. I would suggest another place for drinks which is disappointing because they have such a great bar for it.

One of my coworkers recommended Hook and Ladder for lunch. We arrived and there was plenty of seating available for the lunch hour. I ordered the burger and it was one of the best burgers I have had. It was very flavorful without being greasy. The fries are also very good. Everyone at our table enjoyed their meal.

We went early and found the place nearly empty. Throughout the morning, customers came in and started their own meals. This isn't an unpopular place, just that it's a bit quiet that early. The food is really good and we're looking forward to going back in the near future.

Walked in at 4:15pm by myself for dinner. I travel a lot for work and just needed a place to sit down and eat. This is not a place for that type of thing. It was happy hour and they were just doing appetizers. They were fully booked for dinner at 5pm. I just wanted a place to sit down and eat, now I have to figure something else out. Will the next restaurant I walk into simply let me sit down and eat? Hopefully. I was simply searching for quality, unfussy service and found the opposite here.

This is such a great brunch spot in Sacramento! We were on the hunt for a good place to eat and spotted Hook & Ladder and got curious. While the interior is spacious with plenty of seating, we were seated outside on their cozy back patio which seemed to hide itself away from the bustle of 17th & S. The food was outstanding; they had something that satisfied each of our tastes and diets. Drinks were also on-point, having a good selection of beers, wines, and mixed drinks, we were more than satisfied! Service was excellent and couldn't have asked for more! If you've never been here, try this place for sure!

name: Selland's Market-Cafe East Sacramento
reviews: Really good food and excellent variety.  A little slow when busy.  Large tables good for families or just meeting random people.

Loved the locations and it seems this place provides a bit better customer service than the Broadway Location. Parking might be an issue for some but there is space throughout the residential neighborhood. What really made me give this place 5 stars was the customer service. Normally it doesn't seem they provide refills on some of their drinks but they were happily to oblige. Selland's has always had a good selection and the quality is what I have come to expect from the other location on Broadway which I have visited on numerous occasions.

Arrived just as the restaurant opened. Met friends there for lunch. Ordering is easy. Menu is posted. Paying for food was quick and efficient. I ordered the Crab Louie. Crab was fresh, lettuce was crisp. Salad accompaniments were fresh and flavorful. Ordered salad with dressing on the side and that's the way it came. Every item in the display cases looked yummy. Staff friendly and helpful. Parking is limited. You may have to park on residential streets.  Be mindful of neighborhood parking restrictions.

We came here with a party of four on a Friday night before the Epic Obstacle Course Race. 
You seat yourself and we found a table in the main dining area, but it was pretty busy, so I’d imagine it’s pretty difficult at peak times. Our hosts, natives of the city, were astounded and told us it was hardly ever that busy (classic them). 
We ordered at the counter and the price was very reasonable for two people and a dessert to split (and booze!)

Lemon Chicken Breast-
My wife and her high school friend both had this. The high school friend said that it was one of his favorite dishes, which just shows how much he’s grown, emotionally since graduation. Adulthood is loving lemon chicken for low it’s low carb, high protein ratio. He had it a la carte, splitting the large salad with his girlfriend. I didn’t hear any complaints about the quality from either of them and the bits I ate when they weren’t looking were delicious. 

Teriyaki Chicken Thigh-
I chose this with a side of mashed potatoes and it was fantastic. It was lovely and juicy, with the bone in to preserve some of the flavor of the meat. The skin was slightly crisp and caramelized. It paired well with the mashed potatoes because of the great combination of salty and savory with creamy and buttery. And because anything potatoes is delicious. 

Asian Salad- 
My wife and I split this cold salad between us but I ended up eating most of it because that is my lot in life. It was similar to a Costco salad, with mandarin oranges and the sweet sesame dressing, but it had a great crunch from the purple and white cabbage. 

Mashed Potatoes-
This is one of their more popular side dishes. It’s made from potatoes that have been “mashed”! Who knew?

Broccoli-
Pretty standard steamed broccoli. Inoffensive flavor and a kind-hearted, spiritually-satisfying portion. 

Goat Cheese and Apple Salad- 
The native Sacramentals ordered this and were generous enough to share an amount of it (it was massive). Lovely mix of sweet and savory. Definitely a great summer salad. 

Carrot Cake-
While this cake was made with carrots, it does not have all the inherent health benefits one would expect. However, this is my wife’s favorite cake, so, inevitably, I ate most of it. 

Double Chocolate Cake- 
Twice the chocolate of a normal cake! What’s not to like?

Overall, it was very cool experience and the staff was super helpful and patient with us, considering we made our choices and then completely threw them out when it was time to place our order. They gave great recommendations and, ultimately, helped us stop panicking and decide what to eat.

We absolutely love Selland's and have always had a great time there. Their food selection is excellent and everything we have and there is delicious. My favorite is their Eggs Florentine Pizza with added prosciutto from their brunch menu. I recommend this place for any time you want to dine in or takeout, but their brunch is phenomenal!

name: Petra Greek
reviews: There isn't too many options of Greek food in the Sacramento area. That being said, this is probably the best current location if you ever are craving it. The beef/lamb gyro was filling and the meat tasted great. The Petra fries were also a treat without being too overbearing. Try the fry sauce! They also have a selection of beer that I did not get a chance to drink but I definitely will when I come back for happy hour.
All time favorite restaurant. I used to come here and spent good time. Service is very good. Delicious food. Super friendly staff. Decor of the restaurant is outstanding.

This is a nice low key spot to have great food. The food is fresh and well seasoned. The portions are amazing for the cost. The Petra crew are all awesome.
