I've been here like five times and no matter what I order, I am completely satisfied. In fact, this restaurant is in my top 3 suggestions to family and friends. 
Parking can be a challenge. However it's downtown so it's not a surprise. And trust me, this food is amazing!!!
I love this place! Only Greek restaurant in this town that has the best flavor. If you like Greek food this is the only place to go. Fast service and a lot of food for the price.
This place clearly knows how to take care of their clients. Constantly with a very welcoming approach. The food is reasonably priced, regularly tasty and clean.

name: The Rind
reviews:
This was one of the best meals I've had this year.

Really neat space, and they were able to accommodate our party of 5 rather easily. Food came out at a nice pace- enough to really enjoy each course.

The charcuterie plate was nice. We asked for their pairings with the wine we ordered, and the cheese monger had some nice selections.

Both the mac and cheeses and grilled cheeses are great- I can especially recommend the "Not Your Mom's Mac" and the "T-Brie-D". 

I can't wait to go back. If you haven't been here yet, you're missing out on a FANTASTIC dining experience.

I went here very briefly with a couple of friends one day. They have good wine available as well as some other interesting options. I didn't try anything on the menu other than the wine, but we took a look, and the happy hour looks great.
It is a super cute interior, small and cozy, with a little classy (has to be with the wine and cheese, right?)
The waitress was very friendly and helpful. She gave us a sampling of the wine we got before we went all in for a glass.
Great experience overall, and I hope to be back for a Happy Hour soon.

We stopped by here for some lunch and the food was really good.  It was really pricey though, so I knocked a star.  We got a Charcuterie Board, 2 grilled cheese sandwiches, a cup of sour and 2 beers.  Cost us $100 bucks.

The grilled cheese was good, but should have been bigger at those costs I think.  The service was great though.  Our server (Britney) was super awesome and deserved this shout out for her outstanding service.

FlameMango - best grilled cheese of my life. They additionally have an excellent selection of wine and beer and do build-your-own cheese boards. Great vegetarian options as well. Mac n cheese is decadent.

Yum. All I can say is yum. From the cheese board to the beverage selection The Rind never disappoints. When you are in the mood for a classy take on the ultimate comfort food there is no other place I'd recommend. Adult mac and cheese + grilled cheese for the win!

name: Beast + Bounty
reviews: The ambience is amazing here. Love the decor. Really good and unique options. They're a little pricey but the food is really good and so was the service. We got drinks and didn't like it at first but they remade really well. Food takes a little while. Lots of vegan and vegetarian options. Recommend the pizzas. Most bang for your buck as well

The decor was a big factor in visiting this place, and I loved how the brick from the original building was saved and incorporated into the space. The food was tasty as well, so it was definitely a good find. If you come for brunch, I definitely recommend getting a pitcher of their pomegranate mimosas with your meal, you won't be disappointed!

It’s absolutely beautiful!! but the food is basic for me. The beast burger want that amazing & the fries were too thick for me ( sweet potato fries, wish they were thinner I would absolutely love to have them) first time trying the fries and I’m kinda into it🤷🏻‍♀️ the burger I asked to have cut (recommended) I could barley eat it but the bread wasn’t that good, wasn’t bad but I just had really high expectations for the price. Also bathroom are nice they have a phone holder pretty cool & I just love their aesthetic wish they would have more dessert options:/ I would give it another try definitely. My friend tried the vegan burger and she gave it a 3/10 so I think that speaks for itself but she isn’t vegan just always wanted to try it. She won’t be having that again lol but the waitress was sweet & helpful

Get a reservation! Every part of the menu is off the chart!!! Had the pair salad and the kiwi. Amazing! Followed by the short rib then split a burger w/avocado and bacon added. We literally cleaned our plates

Very Nice Restaurant, You Won’t Be Able To See It Unless You Put Ot On The GPS. Romantic, Cozy, And Clean. I Tried Two Alcoholic Cocktails 🍹 The Rabbit Revenge And The Martini 🍸They Do Taste Really Good, But The Liquor Amount Was Pretty Small; Minimum If You Will, I DiDn’t Even Get Tipsy After Two Drinks, And I’m Not A Huge Guy 😄 My Wife Is Pregnant, So She Got A Non Alcoholic Cocktail And It Was Super Good, With Vanilla And Pear 🍐Flavor, Highly Recommended. We Ordered The Char Grilled Octopus 🐙 And It Was Delicious 😋 The Price Was Reasonable, We Also Tried Their Kale, And Walnut Salad 🥗 It Was Alright, But Over Priced For A No Protein Salad With Some Kale And Walnut (15$ Plus Tax) For Entrée My Wife Ordered The New Yorker And The Steak Was Cooked Really Good And I Ordered The Mixed Grill Plater; Honestly For 88$ Plus Tax I Expected Some Bigger Portions Specially If The Waiter Had Told Me It’s A Very Decent Amount Of Food, On The Other Hand All What I Got Was A Very Average Piece Of Lamb, 2 Average Size Piece Of Kind Of Beaded Fried Ground Beef, And Two Pieces Of Salmon; The Thing Is That It’s Not Even A Salmon Fillet, It’s A Bone In Salmon, And I Barley Literally Barely Found Any Salmon Meat In There. 
For A 88$ Course I Expected Way More Food Than What I Got ☹️ And I Consider My Course The Least Recommended One Out Of All What We Ordered.
For Briefing: Nice Place To Try, Good For First Dates, And Anniversaries, But That’s It...It’s Not Worth It To Visit Again; Good Food Quality, But Super Expensive For The Amount Of Food You’re Getting. And That’s Why I Gave Them Three Stars Only .

name: Frankenwaffle
reviews: Just had a complete breakfast waffle... simply amazing! Definitely coming back to try more waffles in the future. Great microbrew and cider selection. Also have Sierra Nevada Celebration on tap! Highly recommend to try this place.

This place was super fun, and the food was really tasty! I got the taco flavored dog, and my sister got the vegan dog, and a waffle. The gentleman behind the counter was very friendly, and knowledgeable. The food was prepared fresh, and tasted amazing. I would recommend checking this place out if you’re feeling adventurous.
Great food, great service and very clean facility. Loved it, I will be back.

Awesome sausages and waffles. Delicious! The theme is cool and they do a great job of keeping with the theme in their food names and decor. They always have a horror movie on and records playing. Great selection of beer on tap and in cans.

The Frankenwaffle was great. Its like a corn dog but with a waffle, dip it in the house mustard and your taste buds do a happy dance. (Spicy house mustard)I also had a plate of waffle topped with bananas and cream they were so good I didnt even put syrup on. Service was friendly I enjoyed it all. Great place!😃

name: Plan B Restaurant
address: 555 La Sierra Dr, Sacramento, CA 95864, USA
reviews: This is a very cozy place with a mello atmosphere. The food was delicious. I had the rack of lamb and the muscles. The lamb was cooked to perfection and seasoned beautifully. The chefs were light on the salt so you could really taste the flavors. I would highly recommend trying the rack of lamb. The muscles also were full of flavor but left me wanting more of the sauce. This is a nice place to go for small parties or a date night. I definitely want to try other items on their menu next time I go there, I will definitely be going back.

I celebrated my PhD this evening in this excellent restaurant. I am glad to say that it was a pleasant evening and the place was absolutely the reason for the outstanding evening. The team  contributed in a very nice way, the food was tasty and my buddies were very  joyful. We shall absolutely return for more events. Thank you very much.

This restaurant is obviously one of the most attractive place to eat in the neighborhood. Always when I go there I am deeply satisfied. They maintain their very high  standard service and the highest level of dishes  they provide. You are always happy with this restaurant. Very  recommended.
Good food great service. This is an old school chef run restaurant that never disappoints. They pay attention to the details and it shows in everything from decor to food and service.
Amazing filet mignon, salmon, appetizers, and cocktails

name: Iron Horse Tavern
reviews:
Fantastic place to grab some dinner. Nice atmosphere, good food, and cold drinks. 

Wait staff is super friendly. Everyone is so pleasant. 

Meal was fantastic. Started with fried pickles and onions as an appetizer. Saved a few of the fried pickles to put on the Tavern Burger. Good choice.

I would definitely come back here again.

This is such a great spot. I love their patio with the dogs allowed. Service has always been good, often great. The food is yummy and a good range of options. Drinks are great.
I like the look of the place, nice open area inside with wood and tile. The only downside to that is how loud it can get.

Looked on Google for a good Sacramento lunch and was rewarded with trip to the Iron Horse Tavern. 
Wow, a great lunch ! The Cuban sandwich was first rate and with a “real” ginger beer, a delightful meal. I was lucky to find a parking spot, it’s a little tight, but worth the effort.
Stopped in for dinner on my way to Tahoe. Great location. Near plenty of other bars. Food and service was excellent. I'll be coming back here amd highly recommend.
They have good French donuts. Perfect place for a brunch. Lovely patios.

name: Binchoyaki
reviews: Friendly staff. Farm to fork. Innovative food. Not your typical Japanese restaurant serving sushi. So much better and tasty food. Small plates. Grilled items using Japanese Maple charcoal which creates a high heat, smokeless fire while still imparting a grilled flavor. And, a great selection of Sake.
2nd birthday at one is the best restaurants I've ever been to. It was wonderful! The best way to spend a birthday lunch-great service! I can't wait to go back! ♥️♥️

Great restaurant with a quaint and welcoming environment. Came in for lunch, didn't take too long to order and get settled. The Curry Udon was absolutely delicious, and the salad was crisp and perfectly refreshing. Food and service were exceptional. Highly recommend

This place is doubtless one of the best place to eat in the region. Always when I come there I am awfully happy. They always keep their high  standard service and the highest level of meals  they provide. You definitely will enjoy this this place. Highly  recommended.
Fantastic! Unique items on the menu that would make the pickiest of Japanese to be more than pleased! Definitely going back!

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
reviews:
Easily one of the best steak I’ve had. Great upscale ambience and friendly staff. 
My steak was perfect, and there was an extensive selection of wines to choose from. Mashed potatoes and lobster bisque tasted amazing too!
 
As expected, price was on the high side. Will surely be back here again.

Great value for the happy hour items. $9 per good or drink. Nice interior and attentive services.
Happy Hour is 4:00 pm - 7:00 pm Sunday - Friday. Open seating, first come first serve.

I don't think I have ever been here and been disappointed. The food, no matter what you get, is always consistent. I have never had a bad steak here-always cooked perfectly and tastes phenomenal. The sides are "shareable" (I don't like to share tho) for two people. Extensive wine list available and of course a full bar. I enjoy being able to come here and enjoy an upscale meal without having to put on a ballgown.

One of the best steak houses I have ever been to. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. The price was a little high but for the quality of food and service it's worth it. They bring your steak out on a 500 degree plate to keep your steak warm the whole time you're eating it. They also bring out a selection of knives to use. I will definitely be going back some day.

Very nice place for a special dinner.. impressive first date location.. engagement/proposal restaurant. Food was good. Service was great, prices was hitting them pockets but it was very good.  (Get the sweet potato casserole and you won't need a dessert)

name: Yue Huang Restaurant
reviews: Staff are on point with their services along with their food. The tea is super good too.  I know people have different taste buds and may not like this place but me and my little family love it!

The food here is phenomenal. We've ordered a few times for delivery/pickup since quarantine and are for sure making this a regular stop for us. All of the dim sum we've tried was great, as well as the moretl traditional Chinese food dishes they serve.
This place is an absolute delight!  Amazing dim sum! Amazing service!  Amazing restaurant!  This should be a stop on everyone’s list. Get here now!

Service was good, very unusual items on the menu, like sea cucumber and conch. We ordered what we were familiar with: egg rolls, fried shrimp, dumplings, salt and pepper chicken wings, noodles, and fried rice which was outstanding. It had pork and shrimp in it. Very well seasoned and not oily at all... Probably the best I've had in a while.
fresh tasting food and fantastic customer service

name: Claim Jumper Restaurants
reviews:
Their lunch deals are really great. Can get food for 10$. The ambiance is great, service is good and food is tasty. The happy hours are another good reason to go here.

Please do ask for their complimentary bread during lunch. It's delicious. 

I'm docking a star as the fries didn't feel that great during the happy hour. They were kind of chewy, and I didn't feel like they were freshly made.

Absolutely wonderful!!! Took my wife out for our 25th anniversary, service was exceptional, Mule on Fire drink was amazing. Ordered the rib eye steak medium rare, Perfection! Had a great time. Will be returning for certain.

I will start with the good. We had reservations for our anniversary.  My husband had been telling me about this place a d I was so excited to try it. We got their early and I was happy that they could seat us early. In fact, the place was pretty empty. It took a server 10 minutes to get our drink order. We ordered appetizers,  which mine was wrong. There was absolutely no pacing of the meal. We had appetizers,  salads, and our dinner on our table all at the same time. We ended up having no less than 3 servers that night. Getting drink refills was almost impossible, but the place was empty!! Parking is a total nightmare around there too.

Food was very good. My only compaint is they didn't have any of the complimentary bread they usually give out and the baked potato was over baked. The carrot cake was super moist. I would come back to this location.

We met with friends at this restaurant for dinner. This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was a winning. The staff welcomed us with a smile and we had an excellent feeling. The food was just great. We loved this restaurant very much and we shall absolutely come back again. Recommended.

name: El Novillero Restaurant
reviews:
Atmosphere was good. The food, exceptional!
I recommend the shrimp soup. Its crazy good!
Salsa was WAY TOO SPICY HOT!

Excellent authentic Mexican food. The best I’ve ever had. Portions are massive, food is flavorful, family atmosphere! I had the super burrito — couldn’t even finish half. Steak was tender! Absolutely delicious!

Large authentic Mexican restaurant! The food was good, large portions at reasonable prices. The margarita did taste like a mix but it wasn't the worst marg I've had. The restaurant isn't very vegetarian friendly, however I appreciate their honestly writing in the menu what's made with lard (chips, anything fried) chicken stock (rice, etc) and so on... Friendly staff, quick service.

Great food and service. I've been eating here for several years and have never been disappointed. I'm always amazed at how quickly the food is served and how fresh it tastes. I now live 20 miles away and still take the time to make the trip when I want really, really good Mexican food!
For the real experience of Mexico taste this is the place. Its all here. Service courtesy, warm family traditions and price. Try it I know you will feel and taste it. Betty Gray thank you!

name: Español | Italian Restaurant
reviews: Español is a really fun place to eat Italian food.  Yes that's right, Español is a really great place for Italian food!  The four of us celebrated my wife's birthday.  The service was outstanding; they kept up the good service throughout but did not intrude at obvious family moments, very smart.  We had spaghetti and meatballs and raviolis what's great meat sauce.  Of course, they started with a standard salad with blue cheese or Italian or French dressings.  Then, came a wonderful minestroné soup that they kept bringing as long as we wanted until we had our fill.  The entrees reserved as we finished our soup and salad; in other words, they paid attention to the progression of our dinner and waited until we had finished soup and salad before bringing us the main entrees. I like eating establishments that pay attention to detail and do not clutter the table.  The pricing of the menu items is priced well, and I would say moderate.  Not only would I recommend Español, but I give it five stars for it is a great family atmosphere too!!  Español also has a nice cozy little bar that serves bottled beer, wine and liquor.  I like Italian food and we'll be revisiting Español!!

My parents took my Husband and I out to Español. And I have to say this place is amazing...Has a historic touch, with a home like feel and of course the food was amazing. You can get dishes with spaghetti and ravioli. Comes with salad, soap and warm bread. I got the eggplant Parmesan for dinner. Yum!! Family friendly and great for big events too. No need for reservations but would help with big groups.

My daughter had spaghetti and meatballs; I had spaghetti and ravioli combo. I wasn't expecting authentic Italian cuisine, but I figured a place like this should be solid, tasty Italian-American food—a classic red sauce joint. But I was disappointed by the food we got: everything was pretty bland, and the meatballs were dry and chewy. I'd rather spend less and go to The Old Spaghetti Factory.

9 of us came here for a birthday celebration. Love the service here. Friendly personable service. Plates cleared, water filled in a timely matter. Minestrone soup is still very good. The pasta is just alright. The go to dish is the fried chicken with garlic. The chicken cacciatore is another favorite. The pork chop was dry and tough.
Great Italian food just like mom would make. Dinners come with lots of tasty soup, salad and ice cream. Reasonable choice of dinner wines. Would recommend for a nice family dinner.

name: Veg
reviews: Stopped here for brunch on the way up to Tahoe. Everything we had was delicious, high quality and healthy. We ordered a French press coffee, a bourbon cold brew coffee cocktail (their cocktails are delicious), a Kale Caesar salad, the breakfast burrito and the tofu scramble and potato hash. The food was really tasty, big portions but didn’t feel bloated after. Nice artsy atmosphere with really friendly staff. Highly recommended!

Had brunch on our first visit, cozy but spacious upstairs space, price point $12-$18 per dish but portion size was very generous. Staff were friendly and food was amazing. Great selection of teas, beer choices more limited. The chicken (fried oyster mushrooms) and waffles was especially delicious. Will definitely visit again.
Get the CREPE FLORENTINE (and ask for hot sauce). Absolute fire. This place is cute as hell with a nice view. Not ADA accessible tho — you need to climb a flight of stairs to get to the entrance.

4.5 stars. Great service and great food with well done vegan menu.

If pressed I would say that I enjoyed the falafel burger over the more traditionally prepared option, but both were good. The curry bowl was also good. The potato wedges were excellent. Definitely will be coming back.

This place is so delicious. The coconut curry is incredible and the potato wedges (YOU GUYS, THE POTATO WEDGES) were incredible. It is a bit more! We paid about 12-16 a plate and drinks are around 5, but the quality is more than worth it. 
And the ambiance! It’s a nice upper story restaurant with a view and some calm music. The service is great! I’m going here again for sure!

name: La Trattoria Bohemia
reviews: Best pizza in Sacramento! Also, the ambiance is very chill and it has a cool neighborhood vibe. We have been coming here since we moved to East Sac.  I do the gluten free thin crust combo. My husband does the regular combo. The pic of the GF combo speaks volumes to the deliciousness of the pizza. Here is a pic of my leftovers!

Overall a good a experience. The food was really good and the service was quick. The down fall was truly not any fault of the establishment. A reservation for 8 that didn't show up on time and a table of 2 that lingered at their table for almost an hour after paying their bill caused seating to be tight leaving a cold and drafty table by the door our only choice. Make a reservation if you choose to come here and stay away from the table by the door and you should enjoy yourself. Cheers.

Wow wow wow please try this place! Papricas,  schnitzel and patato pancakes are to die for!!! Please just try it I also recommend the beef goulash and the apple strudel everything is out of a grandmother's kitchen homemade and absolutely fabulous the beer is amazing too

The food was fantastic. I also took a bite of my boyfriend's meal and it was equally delicious. I felt the service was rushed and out of sync. It will definitely be worth another try. Also, do not sit at the table by the door. The door kept opening and freezing me out. 😔

We had a family meal here on Christmas eve.  The menu is quite diverse and everyone enjoyed their meal. I shared a  Chicken Paprikash pizza which was phenomenal!  I will reserve the right to "bump up" my rating when we have an opportunity to revisit this restaurant on a less busy day.  I  could just trash the wait staff and service based on that evening, but I realize it was busy,  obviously busier than anticipated,  and will be back to enjoy their offerings again.

name: PARAGARY’S
reviews: Very nice setting (music was just the right volume). Outstanding service (the waitress was there enough to be attentive but not too much to be obtrusive). Excellent food. Price was average to excessive. Was here on day with Prix Fixe menu, so selection was minimal, but the composition and presentation of the food was truly exceptional.

We came to celebrate our anniversary because this is where we had our first date. We were shown to a table where is was so noisy that we would not have been able to talk. The staff had no trouble finding us just the right table.

My pork chop was tougher than I would have liked and my husband's salmon was under cooked. Service was very good.

I haven't eaten at this place yet. Which I am ready to try when the weather gets warmer (since they have a lively outside patio). However, I really like the ambience and their specialty drinks. I would also like to mention the great hospitality from the bartenders and host.

Had a wonderful time at Paragary's for a large group brunch! Avocado toast was the best I've ever had, anywhere! And the lemon ricotta pancakes (topped with blueberry compote) were fabulous, too (sorry, didn't get a photo of the pancakes).

The food and service were excellent. My wife had the fish special and she said it was delicious, I had the short rib stuffed ravioli which was also very good. The only issue we had was that the portions were small for the price we both left the restaurant feeling under fed.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse
reviews:
This will be a bad review. I did not want to post it right after the visit. I was hoping that my brain will a bit erase all the negative, but it did not.
It was our anniversary. I am not a steak person. But my husband is, so i decided to make him pleased and chose the steakhouse. The food was awful. My husband’s steak was burnt. It was super oily and did not taste good at all. I ordered prosciutto mozzarella it was also bad. The sides were bad. Cocktails were disgusting. If you charge $16 for the cocktail- you have to make it right! The service was terrible. We put my husbands jacket at the chair next to us. Every time when the server was near our table he leaned on the chair and put both of his hands on the jacket!!!! It was every time! And he was at least 5 times near our table. We also ordered a draft beer and got it in the bottle. We won’t come back for sure and never suggest it to anyone.

This site is my preferable site.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. everytime  I I need a decent meal, this is the place that comes straightaway to my head.  Great and   food and a rich cuisine.professional staff members, and great mood. In addition to that, the charge is reasonable. I recommend this spot with pleasure.

we went to celebrate an occasion, three adults. All three agree this is some of the best food we've ever eaten everything fantastic. The only one that wasn't to my par was the lobster mac and cheese but everything else was fantastic. The bill was $530 for 3 but we splurged and we'll do it again get reservations and enjoy a fine restaurant. Our waiter was David and he did a fantastic job as well. We had two appetizers a piece and a few drinks, a main course and boy was it good.
Less than expected. Ordered curbside pickup. Steakburgers weren't juicy & fries were cold. Soooo disappointed!

I dine in this great restaurant quite a bit! This is my favorite spot to grab a bite.  I go there routinely. The meals are just great, the crew is welcoming and the prices are reasonable. I enjoy meeting in this restaurant over a rich lunch.

name: The Red Rabbit Kitchen and Bar
reviews: Great atmosphere, beautiful place to have a drink and conversation. The food is good but nothing spectacular. I do recommend this place to let loose and enjoy a meal. Great spot for a date.
The Wellington was only for the dine downtown. It was made perfectly. Crispy on the outside and juicy and tender inside. The pork osso buco is my all time favorite there. Also very crispy!

Didn't beat here because the menu was too limited... Like the music atmosphere and splendid lavender fragrance they had... But without a varied menu selection I didn't bother sticking around to eat because they just didn't have anything I wanted.

This place is my preferred one. I go to a lot of restaurants but to this restaurant I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very amicable and the cooking they place on your table is so appetizing. I never miss an opportunity to have a decent meal in this place. Highly recommended.
The people who make you drinks are very cool and chill. They aren't rude if you personalize your own drink to your liking. Very cool people. They make sure your attended

name: Foundation Restaurant & Bar
reviews: Great for lunch in that they have happy hour menu. Between three of us we ordered fish tacos, burger and French dip. We all very much enjoyed the food, with the onion rings being fantastic, but French fries were just so so.  One issues may be parking, but there is a garage across the street, otherwise there are meters along the front and side, but they may be taken up or restricted based on events.  I'll be returning for dinner to see how the main dishes are, and I have a feeling they will be quite good. I recommend this spot.

This site is my favorite site.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to that place. Whenever  I want to go to a delicious dinner, this restaurant comes first to my mind. splendid and diverse  food and a large menu.courteous team, and agreeable vibes. Also important, the price is modest. I praise this restaurant with great pleasure.

This place was busy. We were seated quickly. Our waiter was great, friendly,  knowledgeable, never left us wanting. 
The food tasted as wonderful as it looked.  I had the fabulous braised short ribs  and it was as generous serving. We will be back.

Amazing vibes and super attentive service. The meals were crisp and delicious. Will absolutely recommend this restaurant to friends and family. Convenient rates and generous portions. Keep up the great work.

This place is located on the corner of 4th and L Street. They have a really friendly atmosphere and the bar is separate from the tables. It is handicap friendly. I joined some friends for Dine in Sacramento. The food is outstanding. I chose the spicy green beans, braised short ribs and the chocolate brownie pie. I was not disappointed. I even took home a doggie bag. Try the brussel sprouts with bacon.

name: Backbone Café | Organic Health Food Sacramento
reviews:
Such a little gem right in J St.. great organic food, lots of vegan options, amazing smoothies and I can wait to come back for the broth bowls.

Such a cozy environment, ultra local vibe, healthy delicious food all the way. They even have a cool book, game and coloring section.

They take cash and cards so no worries there. 

Great salads and even the burger was delicious. Can’t wait to come back.

Yet another great cafe that has a solid selection of vegan options in the Sacramento area. I went with the Vegan BLAT and a side of fries. It was a very flavorful mushroom cap and sauces weren’t too overpowering. Also, the fries were really good. IMO not all places have fries that genuinely hit the spot. 

The location feels a little tucked away but quaint when you get inside. The decor is fun and very mushroom forward. I loved that they had cards on the tables describing different mushrooms and where to find them.

Wow. Who knew? Tucked on the corner I would have never ever have found this place if it wasn't for local guides here.  A group of us gals had a good sampling of their delicious fries and portobello mushroom burger. It was probably one of best organic healthy food restaurants in downtown Sacramento.

This place was a surprise and a great one. The staff were super kind and friendly. The food was amazing and the place has such amazing decor. Its a wonderful place to catch up with friends and coffee/lunch break, a date time or even has a quick bite to eat. Definitely will be coming back here.
Nice little cafe. Enjoyed the power bowl and the Golden milk was as really good, first time trying it iced (cashier’s suggestion, thank you!). Very cozy spot, I look forward to my next visit.
